We saw the reviews of this winery and thought it would be a fun part of our weekend trip, so my three friends and I came in for a wine tasting inside their bar and we were surprised about the snooty service and multiple issues we had. First off, when we were pointed to which bar we'd be tasting at, there was a dirty tissue on the ground that was at our station (which I had kicked away, not wanting to make a fuss out of it). It apparently wasn't cleaned yet before we arrived, so our sommelier wiped it down before placing the menus down. In addition, we were placed right by the exit/entrance door to their storage room where we constantly shuffled away to not block the staff coming in and out.   When she quickly put down some menus and expo markers and asked us to pick 5 wines to try and walked away, she didn't really care to pause and help us with decisions, so I stepped in to help my friends who were less knowledgeable about wines. Throughout our wine tasting process, our sommelier also made really strange comments to us, saying multiple times: "This particular wine is really expensive, so that's why you only get a splash." Not sure why that was necessary to repeatedly state that? It wasn't encouraging us to purchase anything, especially when we weren't enjoying the particular tastes of our wine and she didn't bother helping us give recommendations, other than asking if we had any questions after we already picked our choices. When one of my friends asked about the bathrooms not working, she just curtly answered it was because the pressure gauge was off for the whole place due to the Wells. I understand that's not entirely in their control, but she did not have to respond in a rude way, and unfortunately my friends had to hold their bladders until we got back to our cabin bathroom.  Overall, I recommend people skip the wine tasting indoors and just go straight to the outdoor patios to check out the cute red bus that has the express wine bar service. The person in there seemed a lot nicer, and there were places we could've sat down and enjoyed the nice weather, instead of standing the whole time interacting with our rude sommelier indoors.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: Hilda S.
reviews.description: The views are breathtaking, the wines are fantastic and staff are very friendly. From the whites to rosé and reds, the wines are delightful. Likes them so much that I became a wine club member. Looking forward to returning and introducing friends to this winery.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New winery, family owned and run. Limited selection of tasting to 3 that were made of Texas plains grapes but they were all good wines. The biggest attraction, which will guarantee they'll be successful is the view and gorgeous setting. They put a large deck on the hill so you can enjoy your wine while looking out at the vineyard.

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Wonderful place with some great wines! The staff was delightful and friendly. The place wasn't too crowded but they just opened in November and I think people are going to be learning about this place and packing it out very soon!   They grow grapes on the property but all the wine I had was outsourced since their weren't ready yet. They had three wines to try (white, rose and red) but will be having six very soon as their home grown grapes are about ready. I enjoy dry, less sweet wines and these were perfect. Highly encourage you to put this spot on your wine tours of Wimberly! They also have some snacks/small bites if you are hungry.

reviews.author: Linda A.
reviews.description: This is a "Hidden Gem"!!! What a wonderful winery!!! We went relatively early to avoid any crowd and the staff were welcoming and informative.  They now have 4 wines and all of them were delicious. I'm not a sweet wine drinker and gratefully none of them were sweet. One crisp white, 2 rosés and a red. We left with a bottle of the red and one of the rosés too. The property and views are beautiful. They have two decks with tables and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the wine, the views, the weather and a fabulous charcuterie platter. It is a bit tricky getting there BUT it is well worth it. Don't miss this delightful vineyard!

reviews.author: Kaitlin Z.
reviews.description: Owners were very welcoming and friendly. Wine was great and snacks were so tasty! They had fun games and beautiful places to hang out on the property. Definitely will return.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: The customer service was amazing!  We were treated like family and enjoyed our experience tremendously.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting. You choose 5 different ones for $11, making this one of the more affordable options around this area. It comes out on a wooden board with stemless glasses. It would have been nicer if the servers gave a bit more description about each of the wines, but they were all very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Haley C.
reviews.description: Literally so good! We were the only people in there on a Monday just before close and the service was great. It was even happy hour and we didn't even know it! The wine tasting was great and a GREAT value during happy hour.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Meh. It was nothing special. No ambiance. Service was decent. Food was delicious. But overall the experience was just normal.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Ac, Texas tasty wines and friendly people.  What else can you ask for ?   We worth the $11 sampling price.

reviews.author: Oscar S.
reviews.description: Great place just to get away and have a good brew. Great wine stop... nice people nice atmosphere!! Thank you

reviews.author: Carole B.
reviews.description: Totally disappointed.  Asked for a menu...ordered a bottle of wine and 10 minutes later we go to order food to be told the kitchen is closed!!!  Really at 7:40?  You couldn't tell us that before wine was bought!?  So we get to sit there and drink wine while everyone around us are eating.  Never again!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Nice place to sit and cool off in Wimberley. They have tons of wine samples, drinks and some small appetizers. Plus a wall full of snacks and specialty foods to bring home for that special occasion. I spun the way back wheel and got some pickled eggs. I made it normal (kind of) by adding some flavored pecans.

reviews.author: Chelsea G.
reviews.description: This place is a must! Super cute wine shop/country store with a very chill vibe. We did a wine tasting and a cheese plate and everything was perfect! We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Luis D.
reviews.description: Great little charcuterie board with good ambience and delicious drinks. This place is worth the trip to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: A great place for sips, sauces, wine and more. Not only can you sample the sauces and dips but they offer wine tasting. They also have 35 craft beers. I definitely recommend stopping in.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Taste Buds is a cool little shop located in the tourist town of Wimberley, TX. It has been taken over my new owners and it had a name change, but most of what the former owners carried is still available, though some things are not; however, the new owners do offer some new things. They do offer some beers and wines, but my biggest interest is the hot sauces, salsa's, and pickles. They do offer some free samples and if you're not a chili head like me, be careful as the ghost pepper and the scorpion salsa's offer a very quick and very hot bite that will get your attention !!!!

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: LOVE this place!! The food and drink selection was fabulous! So excited for Buda!! I would like it if the employees wore their masks correctly though. One didn't have one at all, but had gloves and the others had them almost covering their mouths, but not their noses. Soon there will be a vaccine, but until then... please.

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place when we arrived in town and really glad we did. They serve tons of Texas wine and do wine tastings too. The other half of the building is stocked with cool Texas made dips and jarred goods. Our server was so nice and was easy to talk to! Also, we really appreciated that they were dog friendly! Overall a great place it's stop and check out while you're in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Joanna R.
reviews.description: Our first time here and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Quaint, welcoming stop before we walked around. Perfect place to stop in and relax, enjoy a glass, and a small bite to eat. Thank you Los Olivos for being a part of my Mother's Day weekend.

reviews.author: Wendy b.
reviews.description: We happened into this place by chance, and SO glad we did! Not only did Rylee take great care of us, she went above and beyond to make sure our Anniversary was fabulous! Home made secret champagne recipe and all! Cheers!

reviews.author: Elle L.
reviews.description: Quaint shop on main street. Small, wine bar with a few beer on tap. Small menu. Cheese trays look great. You can buy other gourmet items from their gift shop. Great service. Nice place to rest and cool down from shopping this historical downtown.

reviews.author: Tony T.
reviews.description: Ordered two of their sandwiches and they never came after 25 minutes.  Poor service, never checked in on, they were too busy serving a larger party who got there after is. Someone finally came to tell us our food was coming, 5 minutes later, nothing...we had enough and left.  Eating at Wimberly Cafe, much better food and service.

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: Super laid back and casual spot for epicurean gifts, wine tasting, beer tasting and even wine-a-ritas!! Be sure to get the queso and chips as well as a refillable winearita koozie bottle! The servers are all very friendly and knowledgeable. Overall just a great place to hang out for a bit and enjoy your evening.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: Lots of goodies in this place, one of my weaknesses is pecans with just about anything on them....quite a collection of sauces including Silver Leaf from Missouri City....they need some Mikey V's.....

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Em L.
reviews.description: My visit was 5 years. I opened of the bottles I got there finally... dammmmmmn! Its so good !  Go ! You won't regret.

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

reviews.author: Devika D.
reviews.description: Staff was really friendly and explained all the wine choices to us. I went with my friends and we're not wine connoisseurs so that was super helpful. You order by the bottle. The outdoor area was beautiful and tables were all well distanced for covid.

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Phillip S.
reviews.description: As a wine club member I was told to not smoke in the parking lot. They just lost me as a longtime customer and I will tell everyone to not go there. VERY POOR customer service people, you just lost a lot of business over 1 cigarette. My friends and I will never be back.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The view here and ambience is absolutely amazing. We did a wine flight and then brought a glass to their seating area. Wine itself was just OKAY. The view is incredible. You get a take home glass with the tasting!

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Patricia V.
reviews.description: It was an awesome peaceful experience.  The wine was full of flavor and wonderful taste of wines. The property is so beautiful.  It would be a perfect location for a wedding or vows renewing. The winery also offers a small bistro and gift shop with great items to purchase. I will recommend Driftwood and will come back!

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Good wine, good scenery, but the lady checking us in made it bad. First, I'm 21 and so is my best friend. We went with her parents, and her dad likes to joke around. We shared our ID's (after already confirming with someone else that we are at least 21 and allowed to enter), and he made a joke about us having fake ID's. Obviously we don't have fake ID's, this lady could've scanned them and checked. Anyways, she then proceeded to yell at all of us about how we can't allow anyone under 21 in the winery, she even yelled "NO ONE IS ALLOWED IN HERE UNLESS THEY ARE TWENTY ONE, PERIOD," she really did say "period" which immediately made my friend and I annoyed. Just very mean and disrespectful. I understand that she was trying to enforce the rules but we are over 21 and she did not have to explain the rules in such a rude way. Even her coworkers seem to not like her that much, they gave her the side eye, like she's THAT lady at work.  Then we did the wine tasting and the lady who poured us our wine was absolutely lovely. So sweet, gentle, kind, and even in the wine tasting area we had a great view of the hills and nature around us. The wine was very good. we liked almost everything, and even bought a few bottles.  After this, we went to buy some bottles and a glass of wine, again meeting the lady from earlier. A hand washing towel that my friend bought wasn't scanning correctly snd she got VERY mad at my friend for it. She took out her frustration from the computer on my friend. She was basically yelling at her and telling her to get another hand towel of the same price, she was interrupting us, I was ready to snap at this lady. She was VERY rude the whole time. She got the entire room of customers quiet from her yelling at my friend. She was just clearly very frustrated but should not have taken it out on my friend, family and I. This winery is incredible, but her attitude, frustration, and behavior knocked my rating down from 5 to 3. I was gonna put a 2 because of her, but the winery was amazing, it deserved a 5, but this woman made a serene and calming experience a bad one. My friend and I are both 21 and it isn't our fault the computer messed up scanning a hand towel. There were a few more negative experiences we had with her but these were the worst ones. Even the other customers in the room who were complete strangers to us saw her being this rude, controlling, and mean and visibly for uncomfortable. This company would be a 5 star place without her ruining everyone's experiences.  EDIT: Her name is Aileen. I don't know how it's spelled but my friend that I mentioned remembered her name because we were planning to call the company and inform them about her rudeness to customers.

reviews.author: Harry C.
reviews.description: Great setting and wonderful view and good wine.  The bistro food is on scale of 2 out of 10.  I never tasted such poor quality food.  Even if you order a soft drink, you get it in a can, they don't even have ice.  If your looking for a meal, go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Holly N.
reviews.description: Really disappointed in the customer service at this winery. We called to see if reservations were required and what time the last tastings were served. The woman on the phone said no reservations needed and the last tasting was at 5:30pm (winery closes at 6pm). We walked up to the check in host at 5:31pm for him to say in a smug tone, "Oooh we just closed up".  I told him what the lady on the phone said and he said, "yeah sorry". I was surprised at the lack of hospitality as we would have been out of their way by closing time and were looking forward to supporting a local winery during these difficult Covid times.  Better luck next time I suppose but left a less than wonderful taste in my mouth. I'll wash that taste down with wine from another winery!

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you have a big group don't waste your time coming here. This establishment doesn't want your money. They made that clear today.

reviews.author: Alim B.
reviews.description: Great place. The service is amazing! Everyone that works there has a vast knowledge of the wines. I would recommend getting a membership as well! Totally worth it! Also the view is to die for!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.  I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place. We had been feeling stuffed but this wine was so light and enjoyable to help digest our food while we enjoyed their peaceful tranquil outdoor seating area near a cute little pond. We also took advantage of their photo opportunity landscapes.

reviews.author: Mariz V.
reviews.description: I've had my fair share of vineyards from local like Grape Creek in Fredericksburg then to Castello di Amorosa in Napa Valley. I was embarrassed after taking my family to experience the wine tasting here. Although, some of the wine were fairly tasty, but the serving was small compared to the vineyards I mentioned in the beginning. I had never been to a wine tasting with a pour stopper that was new to me. Mind you they charge $20 per person for wine tasting. We were observing a table near us that was getting extra pour from the pour stopper technique. We decided to order 2 cheese plates ($25/plate) that came in this container after we finished it, which was a small portion by the way. We noticed that the container said "Best By: 2/12" we visited 2/13. So we alerted our server she politely checked with the back she was told that it meant Arrived By, which to me was odd. If it was "Arrived By" I think that's what they would've put on the container but I guess just to shut us up.  As to COVID capacity the patio was full we couldn't wait to leave. This is my family and I's experience I wish it could've been better.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Our favorite wine spot in Austin. Their Meritus is a winner every time. Cute and cozy spot, very picturesque and everyone who works here is super nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Nancy knows. As the owner she curates great wines at affordable prices and makes them available to her friends. Everyone is her friend! This is a generous, comfortable place and the perfect spot for a leisurely afternoon of sipping.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this charming wine shop for the first time, and absolutely loved it! First of all super pet friendly, so we were off to a great start. I'm not too familiar with wine, so Nancy made a fabulous suggestion. The sparkling wine Naveran hit the spot!   The ambiance is chill, so you want to stay awhile. She has beautiful local art decorating the indoors and plenty of outdoor seating. There is also lovely music playing in the background, and just a friendly place! Will definitely make it a must visit spot on trips to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: I picked this place at random when my friend and I decided to meet up near Wimberley. It had good ratings and it looked nice. It turned out to be the best decision; there was a huge event (and beautiful weather) so the heart of Wimberley was PACKED. This place is a bit outside of the main part of town and had plenty of parking, and the best part was it was not crowded. :) They've got minimal seating inside, but plenty of outdoor seating. They also have a nice selection of both beer and wine, plus some yummy snacks (like edamame and hummus!). My friend and I both opted for the wine flight: 4 tasters of wine ranging from red to white to bubbly, all great, and the staff was attentive and ready with the next pour in order to keep the cold ones cold. We had a lovely experience. I definitely recommend if you're near the area!

reviews.author: Paul V.
reviews.description: Fantastic spot in an idyllic setting.  Nancy is very entertaining as are the two other gals who run the place Lia and Katie.  The international wine selection is tops.  Beer too!  And my dog was allowed !

reviews.author: Denise M.
reviews.description: Message the owner on Monday to confirm her hours today. Only to show up and be told she closed at 6:00.  I won't be returning.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Wow! Was driving back down from Dripping Springs and came through Wimberley and sure am glad we did.  This little house is full of rooms and nooks that give it a very intimate feel where you and your friends and family can congregate and feel at home. The bar is loaded full of wines and the staff here isn't shy in regards to providing you with samples and information on each of them.  I don't know very much about wine, but was able to follow along and still get an enjoyable experience out of what they had to offer here. We came on a Sunday afternoon so you know I had to try the mimosa out. Crisp, clean, and refreshing!  Be prepared to shell out some $$ as this place isn't the cheapest option, but you do get a high quality and a large amount of variety which is hard to find in Texas.  Support this local business and lets keep their doors open! Spots like this are hard to come by.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I finally made it here!! Unfortunately, the owner Nancy was on holiday break however, Dawn did not disappoint!! She not only catered to me, but also to my husband, son and his girlfriend by making us feel like family!! Dawn made a cozy fire for us to sit around and kept the rosé, beer and Pellegrino pouring!! We couldn't ask for a better ambiance. Thank you Casa Vindemia!!

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: I notice this little wine shop in Wimberly as I walked past and fell in love with the wines from international wines from all over the world. Today I did wine tasting for six dollars a for several wine tastings plus you get a cute small wine glass for free. Delightful place to take your spouse or date.  The host is very smart about the wines they sell here and enjoyed the smooth wines tastings I received. It located downtown Wimberly so you can't miss it. I certainly will visit again soon. It does cost a few dollars more but worth the fun you have visiting such a cute cosy wine store. So stop in and see what I mean .....happy wine hunting!!!

reviews.author: Jack R.
reviews.description: A sweet little place to escape the cares of the world. Nancy chooses great wines for her customers and has both glasses and bottles available.  She also has some high quality beers and other drinks for sale. If the weather's nice enjoy your time under the oak trees outside.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: We came here for a friend's birthday party as a first stop on our party bus tour, and the wine tasting was fantastic. I highly recommmend coming here any time. The ambiance is adorable, outside seating available. The staff is very knowledgeable about all of the different wines. The tasting was lovely, and then we each had a glass of our favorite!

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: Nancy the owner is very knowledgeable! The shop has moved from its original spot to this bright beautiful spot next to cypress creek! Small unique international wines, reasonable tasting price, and great atmosphere! Stop by and you'll be glad you did!

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: When in Wimberley you must stop by and have a tasting of CV's great selection of international wines! Nancy is a walking/talking Wine 101! Good drink and conversation!

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: What a great little spot! Small quaint tasting room with a bit of wine related retail.   Right near the square and very close to Wimberley Cafe. Very reasonable tasting price at$7 for 6 wines. You can order the dry red flight, the white flight or the sweet flight. Most all the wines from the Escondido Valley in west Texas. This is were most of the grapes are grown in Texas anyway although not widely publicized. Lost Draw Cellars and William-Chris are two of our favorites. Really enjoyed both the red and white flights. The sweet flight is VERY sweet and all about fruit. One exception is the Choco-wine. Sounds really awful- chocolate wine!? I am NOT a sweet eater and don't really like chocolate but this is a perfect combination similar to non-dairy Baileys.   So enjoyed the owner-host that helped navigate the wine. Super personable and great to talk to. We'll return here again!

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: This little shop offers tastings from various Texas and other wineries, organized by a preset menu of either whites, dry reds, or sweet wines. You pay $7 for an etched glass promoting Wimberley as a Little Taste of Heaven (well, why not?), and that includes the tasting of all the wines from the menu of your choice.  There's room for about 6 or 7 people at a time to belly up to the antique bar (standing room only), and the sommelier/host pours for each group separately, explaining each wine and its history as he/she goes.   The afternoon my friend and I were there, we both tried the dry reds, and our host was knowledgeable and entertaining. There was not a bad wine in the bunch, although we each had our separate favorites. A lot of these wines are served by the glass or bottle in the local and regional restaurants, and you can buy them here more reasonably (about $22-36/bottle for the reds we tried) without having to visit each winery. They also have an entire wall of wine-related gift items and cute bar accouterments.  Definitely a place to put on your list to stop by during an afternoon of shopping in Wimberley. Be aware that like most of the shops, they close up for the day at 5PM.

reviews.author: Carmen P.
reviews.description: We called Hill Country Wine Shoppe and spoke to Jill. We wanted to order two bottles of wine for our Aunt and Uncle to help them celebrate their 55th wedding anniversary but we live in Tucson. We had stopped in the store during our last visit and found the shoppe to be welcoming and the owners charming. We told Jill want types of wine our relatives like. She suggested two wines, included a note from us, and facilitated the delivery. Our ralatives were very pleasantly surprised and they said the wines were delicious. We highly recommend this store! Thank you Jill!

reviews.author: Cody J.
reviews.description: The old bar is beautiful and from an old Willie Nelson movie, "Red Headed Stranger." Their "dry" red wines were not dry. They were all very fruit forward compared to the traditional tasting notes of the types they are serving. It's a cheap tasting at $7, and comes with a glass that is etched with "taste of heaven" and Wimberley on it.  Now, it's more of a shop, than a winery. So, don't expect to have a few glasses, sit down, or to use a restroom. The girl that was waiting on us was very young and knew very little about wine, and seemed to care very little. That's not the best wine experience! If I came back, it would be to show my boyfriend the bar. Overall, the wine was mediocre! So, it's kind of a one time thing!

reviews.author: Kori S.
reviews.description: A tasting here is a must do while visiting Wimberley!!! Great Texas wine selection - actually the BEST! After a tasting grab you some bottles and you won't regret it. William Chris is my go-to when stopping in. The Rodeo Red Malbec and Choco Noir are also hard to beat. Happy tasting!!!

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: The best wine we had on our trip was from Hill Country Wine Shoppe!! Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of great wineries and vineyards in the vicinity but Hill Country definitely finds the best. Stop in for a casual quick tasting and be sure to get a few bottles of your favorites. You won't tend to find these in the grocery store!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Take a break from shopping and enjoy some of our Texas wines. This tasting room offers several wines from around Texas. They do have a set list. You can only choose from reds, whites or sweets. The tasting comes with a free glass. It's a cute souvenir. The lady serving us that day was very knowledgeable and even gave us a history of each wine and winery with each pour. The tasting room is small and can get crowded. There's no sitting, but it's not a bother. They do sell some cute wine associated items. I ended up leaving with wine and extras. I can see myself going back when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Terrific service, very knowledgable staff and delicious wines.  Go and taste and get some fabulous goodies.  A must visit when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Just $7 buys a glass and tastings of five wines. Extraordinarily friendly host explained each wine and all the wine regions of Texas. A few great choices, all Texas grown.

reviews.author: Laurie S.
reviews.description: We did the tasting and left there with 6 bottles.  The ladies were very knowledgeable and helped us find what we like.  I must say, I really enjoyed the Choco Noir.  Pinot Noir and chocolate....amazing.  Need I say, I enjoyed my Sunday morning coffee/hot chocolate.   Thanks ladies.  Loved the experience!!!

reviews.author: Cody E.
reviews.description: Disappointed. Not greeted when entering and helped the person who came in after my girlfriend and I. I can't rank the wine because I was never served any.   No southern charm in this swanky.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I was not impressed at all by the wine tasting here. I would recommend this place for the wine merchandise over the wine tasting/ wines. (I purchased a candle). It is a very small place with a bar that has no seating. They hand you a menu with with 3 lists of wine (Red, White andSweet) and tell you to pick one and they go down the list and give you a sample of each one off the list you chose. There was only 1 gentleman working at the time we myself and 2 friends went and he was too busy to even acknowledge us. We waited while he finished up with other customers then started the tasting. The man told us what we were drinking, which we read from the list, but other than that, seemed to have no other wine knowledge. A few times he told us about the wine maker who was featured in a magazine, or gave us facts about the prizes a wine had won, but no true wine knowledge about what we were drinking. I had to even ask for water to rinse my glass between tastings. He was just pouring wine after wine in my friends' glasses, even a white after a red! This was the strangest wine tasting I have ever done and to be honest, not something I would ever pay for. We had a gift certificate for a free tasting.   Bottom line, if you know anything about wine, I don't recommend it. If not, and you're just looking for a casual experience with a little wine involved, go for it.

reviews.author: Stephanie L.
reviews.description: My mom and I visited this place on a Thursday afternoon. It was so much fun! The guy working was so knowledgeable and entertaining and had us laughing the whole time. Delicious wine!

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Stopped in with my family while on vacation. Great wines and good conversation with the man working at the time. It's worth your time to stop by!

reviews.author: K T.
reviews.description: I love this wine shop when the young girl was there.  She was fun and accomodating and we always bought more than one bottle.   However, when the owner is there, she is rude, condescending, and cheap.  Pours a few drops in a tiny cup.  I won't buy anything from her. ...and if she continues with that poor service, I won't ever go back.    So, let's see???  Act friendly and let people actually taste the wine...you get business. You act rude and give people cheap service ---- no business.  It is shocking to me that people have such poor business sense - especially in this economy.

reviews.author: Emily C.
reviews.description: We regularly go wine tasting here.  They only stock wines from Texas wineries that make batches too small to distribute to stores, plus one red and one white wine from Italy for the Italian restaurant goers across the street.  It's like visiting half a dozen wineries in one stop.  The wine lists change minimally throughout the year, though, and sometimes they can't get a particular winery's top products (ex. Sistercreek won't sell them their best blends).  Wine tasting is $7 per wine list (red, white or sweet), and each list includes ~8 wines.  Purchase 3 bottles and the tasting is free.  Purchase 6 bottles and 1 tasting is free + 10% off.  My husband and I usually taste both the red and white lists and walk away with 3-4 bottles of wine.  Each bottle is only a few dollars more than if bought at the wineries.  If you want to taste more than 1-2 types of wine, please be respectful and purchase a wine tasting.  They get a lot of foot traffic and can't give all their wine away.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Had an amazing experience today at the Wine Shoppe. The wines are fantastic and the customer service is amazing. The two short hair blonde ladies go above and beyond for customer service. I learned a ton about Texas wines and how they are made.

reviews.author: john j.
reviews.description: Stopped by, last night.  The woman I was with asked for a sample of the Christmas Wine and was given a plastic goblet that held about an ounce, or more, of wine.  She ended up buying a bottle.  I asked about the blueberry wine and was asked if I'd like a sample.  I was given an ultra-mini, paper souffle cup to drink from.  I then asked for a sample of the mead.  Again, I got a mini-cup and, inexplicably, an extremely rude, "That's the last sample I can give you" from the owner.  Keep in mind that my friend got a sample, in a plastic goblet, that was five times the amount I received in the paper mini-cup.  She also bought a friggin' bottle of wine.  There was no excuse, ZERO, for the owner's rude way of treating me.  As I sipped the mead, groups of women came in and the owner was all over herself to serve them and strike up animated conversation.  I was amazed and angry.  Maybe there's more, here, than meets the eye, but that's not the point.  I should have been treated as well as the women customers.  I certainly wasn't.  I will never go back to this place.  You can count on that.  The reason I gave the two stars:  The owner was extremely knowledgeable about wines.  She did give me good information about sulfite content of the sweeter wines, comparing sulfite addition in wine to oatmeal addition in meatloaf.  Mitigating factor?: She did tell my friend that her store had been flooded by a broken refrigerator while she was visiting her husband in another state.  She struggled to reopen her store once she got back to town, just a day ago. Even so, her rude behavior cannot be excused.  FWIW, my friend told me that if this woman had responded to me, in the manner she did, before she, my friend, had purchased the bottle of Christmas Wine, she would not have completed the purchase.

reviews.author: Elle G.
reviews.description: We were traveling back home after a July 4th trip with our pup. It had just rained so we looked for a place that had outdoor seating.  The first time I was there I remembered picnic tables so we took a chance. There was already a line when we arrived at 11:30 am.  All of the outdoor tables were wet and no one was  eating outside. People were just standing around the picnic tables waiting to be called inside.  I asked the hostess if we could sit outside since we had the pup. She said due to the rain they didn't have any servers working the outdoor tabled so she recommended that we order to go and were welcome to use the picnic tables.  We had our waterproof picnic blanket with us so that was perfect.  Also, the picnic area was BYOB so my husband had a beer from our cooler before we got our meal.   We had the ribs and burnt ends plate with sweet tea.  The plate came with potato salad, coleslaw and baked beans.  The coleslaw hang a tangy taste as did the bbq sauce. We both really enjoyed our meal and will be back next time we're in the area.

reviews.author: Bailee C.
reviews.description: This place clearly has a cult following.   Not worth the wait or money.   The BBQ sauce is pretty amazing.   Sunday 12pm was a 90 minute wait for two people. We opted for a to go order. Took about 30 minutes. We ordered the brisket and ribs meal for $27. You would have thought the meat was top notch expensive stuff with how little they gave us. And to think, for $3 more (and 60 minutes more of a wait) we could have gotten all you can eat.  Thank God for the delicious BBQ sauce I poured all over the meat as well as the sides. If it wasn't for the sauce I would have thought I had Corona virus because this stuff had no taste.   I see reviews saying they only accept cash. We paid with a credit card. There was a minimum payment for alcohol though. I think it was $18.

reviews.author: Allison B.
reviews.description: Very good and decent sized combo plate for $20 or so.....the place is enormous and popular so when you see the lines at first you think you'll be waiting forever, but we only waited for 30 to 40 minutes and when we sat down service was very fast. It's BYOB or you can get wine or beer (I recommend lone star) in the cellar that's right next to the BBQ.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Wow what a disappointment!  Brisket is hard and has its form it's so stiff!  Beans are like a can of ranch style, I thought with all the reviews this place was great.

reviews.author: Gwendolyn S.
reviews.description: Dillon (Dylan) was fantastic. He steered us well during our tasting and we went away with 3 bottles of excellent vino and a mixed 6-pack of beer.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves (even had a good laugh at the tipsy women imbibing). Wish we could have ordered wine at the restaurant though. I knew we wouldn't be able to finish a full bottle and still drive back to Austin so the wine stayed stoppered. My husband was able to enjoy a couple of his beers, so a win for him.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After eating delicious bbq next door my wife and I decided to do a little wine tasting. A charming western style building houses the wine tasting room.  There are little items for sale like candles and honey.  I tasted a few where one was too tangy for me but did pick up a bottle of Salt Lick Cellars BBQ White.    Outside will find tables under huge oak trees and games to play like bocce ball. This place is designated as over 21. Besides wine they sell buckets of beer bottles to enjoy.

reviews.author: Kristina I.
reviews.description: My fiance and I come here on a Thursday and the place was empty (just how we wanted it).  The bartender in the tasting room was very friendly and helpful.  We chose a bottle of wine that was a very reasonable price and finished most of it before we at next door. The grounds are pretty and there is plenty of seating!

reviews.author: Kyle R.
reviews.description: I've been to salt lick two times. I've been to Austin four times. The only reason I didn't go all four times is time constraint/ lack there of vehicle.   It's a nice drive out of Austin, getting a little taste of Texas hill country. Ideally I'd go to a swimming hole near by, then stop at salt lick for a great meal to finish the day.  Everything is delicious and it's an awesome atmosphere. Plenty of outdoor seating which makes it an even better experience.

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: The Salt Lick Cellars was a nice little bonus to our trip to The Salt Lick bbq. With a little bit of a wait ahead of us, we decided to walk over to the cellar for some beers. You walk down the sidewalk along side of the actual Salt Lick restaurant and drool as you see the other patrons inside eating their bbq.   As you enter the cellar you are faced with various wines wall to wall hut on the far left, their selection of beers. We looked over their beer selection and picked up 3 buckets of various beers including lone star and shinerbock. After grabbing our buckets, we enjoyed some on their benches outside. From there you can enjoy looking at their vineyard or play some bocce ball. Or you can walk back with your drinks back to the wait area to be seating.   Perfect side stop if you're looking for an adult beverage while you wait if you forgot to BYOB

reviews.author: Kristi H.
reviews.description: My review is tainted, I admit, but it is still valid.  What do I mean tainted?  Well, it was a girls weekend, we were soaked to the bone and freezing, unhappy/snippy tenders, and we were jammed in a tiny wine tasting room stuffed with other people trying to avoid the rain.  The fellow customers were likely just as unhappy as we were, but there was wine!  One note though - everyone else was just standing there, we were the only ones that were paying customers and we STILL got attitude.    Our least favorite tasting we did all weekend, but wines were good (not great).  Need to try again one day when there is great weather!

reviews.author: Kyle P.
reviews.description: This place has the best I mean theeeee best bison ribs and potato salad. Open seating for outdoor orders. There are 2 main buildings but the wait for a table was over an hour. Sat outside, food came out super quick. Even got to go in the back and check out where they smoke all the bbq. Authentic as it comes. Texas bbq. This places is BYOB there were even college kids with handles of liquor on their tables as if it was almost a daily event or something to do on the weekend. Atmosphere is cool and kid friendly but you can also have a great time in the winery. Definitely a must if you visit austin, it will not disappoint my meal was about $33 and this place is cash only. The ATM wasn't working so this was somewhat of an issue but we got it handled. Awesome bbq

reviews.author: Tasha K.
reviews.description: Best place I happened upon ever! We were leaving the Dutchman winery and looked over and saw a mass of people. My bf turned around and we decided to check it out. Such a great surprise: BBQ and wine! What's not to like? Beautiful grounds, lots of outdoor and some indoor seating. People from all walks of life enjoying the weather and listening to some good live music. BBQ was really good and came with all the fixings. Winery ladies were very approachable and helpful. So glad we stopped in. It made the day.

reviews.author: Jennie C.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of wine and beers, enjoy here or next door at salt lick bbq. Outdoor garden area and bar are amazing. So many flowers and greenery. Say hello to Maggie  cutest dog. Get the 6 pack of beer ($16)u can always take it home. Wayyyyy cheaper than $4 ea.

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: We went around 2 on a Saturday and as you could imagine, it was pretty busy, but we still got good  service. I mean what else do you do after a 6 mile walk  through the parks but stop for wine!   We got good service inside, both the woman that helped us and the younger guy behind the bar were very friendly and helpful .   We both did a wine tasting (I did the whites) and hubs did the reds. 5 tastings for 12$ which I thought was pretty reasonable. The Chardonnay they had was pretty good along with another I can't pronounce . Hubs enjoyed a couple of the reds as well.  Both left with a cup of white sangria while waiting for our food next door. It was a perfect day to enjoy it on the patio as well.   Would we take an Uber out from Austin just to go here, meh probably not. However, if you're in the area it's a great spot with friendly service. When we're back in the area with friends we'd go back.

reviews.author: Janelle M.
reviews.description: Pretty decent Texas wine. We did a tasting and we liked every wine we tried and bought the bbq red.

reviews.author: Will A.
reviews.description: Very good wine and tasting experience while waiting on a table to get BBQ. You can take a bottle of wine or beer from the cellars into the restaurant which is awesome!

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: If you have a long wait and run out of beer, the cellars is a great place to get some beer.   Located on the same property as Salt Lick. Follow the path and you will see signs for the cellar.  Good selection of can and bottle beers.   6 pack - $14 - You can mix 2 different beers. Comes in an ice bucket and you can bring it to the picnic area at the Salt Lick while you wait.

reviews.author: Yilan Y.
reviews.description: Honestly so disappointed by the service and quality. We waited for a long time to get our six pack, then when we started drinking it, we noticed that the beer had a best by date of December 18th which was a week and a half ago. When I brought this to the bartender's attention, she said that she could only give us new beers if they hadn't been opened. She also said that the best by date didn't mean anything and brushed off my concerns. This is a quality issue. No restaurant or store should be charging full price or even selling goods past their best by date. I find this extremely upsetting as I've spent money on beer that should have been sold a week and a half ago. Also, we opened the beers but stopped drinking immediately after noticing the date on all the bottles. I don't think a cellar should be able to sell beer or wine past the best by date, and I'm sure no one wants to buy it either. Word of advice, check the date on the bottles before opening. Or better yet, don't bother waiting in the lines and spend your money elsewhere.

reviews.author: Tiffany S.
reviews.description: The deck and view are worth interacting with the lady who worked here. I came in and said I wanted to get a glass of wine to take back over to the restaurant. She said "Ok" and gave me a menu. I was a little surprised she didn't try to talk me through any wine options or tell me about the Winery off the bat. Just an OK and then she turned away to talk to another guy who worked there about "this lady they apparently both know who's daughter is so big now"...   Honestly I learned alot about that lady and nothing about their wines. Went with the chilled rosé. After she'd already poured it she goes 'Oh! This is a dry bubbly, is that ok?' - It was, because I love dry champagne, so lucky us. I would have done a tasting if asked, I read on a sign they are $12. I probably would have bought a bottle if I had been able to pay for a tasting.   In short, the rosé was in fact dry but really tasty. Service just dry.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: The Salt Lick BBQ restaurant does NOT sell alcohol but the Salt Lick Cellars, a 20 foot walk away through the courtyard, does. Five stars off the top for the Cellars being a kid free Zone. The rustic tasting room offers wine by the glass or bottle. Unlike the restaurant they do take credit cards. They allow you to bring your wine or beer back to the restaurant to have with your meal. The staff were super friendly. I had a bottle of Rose which was very nice.

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: My wife and I went to Bella Vista Ranch for a 4th of July tour with lunch, and we found it to be terrific value for the money. There was a nice lunch from a food truck (the name of which eludes me, unfortunately) followed by an interesting talk about the history of olive oil and the origins of the Italian family farm dating back to the second century BCE. The owner explained how he established Bella Vista on the ancient Roman model and described the modifications he has made to make olives grow in Texas. Then we toured the olive orchard and learned about the different varieties of grapes grown on the property. We saw the processing room containing the "frantoio" or olive press as well as the vats where this year's wines are aging. We then tasted several oils as well as four glasses of wine per person. All this for $25 (the regular tour without lunch is only $15).  Oils, vinegars, wines and soaps are available for sale. These are pretty expensive (e.g. $18+ for 250ml of their basic Texas Blend oil), but I don't mind paying those prices for high-quality locally produced specialty goods. This is a fascinating day out, which I recommend wholeheartedly.  Pro tip: If you're coming from San Antonio, take I-35 instead of US 281 and the back roads. We were expecting a relaxing drive in the country, but construction and traffic made it a stressful trip. Coming back on 35 was a joy by comparison!

reviews.author: Ann S.
