(a) All persons shall be entitled to the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, and privileges, advantages, and accommodations of any place of public accommodation, as defined in this section, without discrimination or segregation.   Corporate lawyers of Starbucks, Whole Foods, HEB, Home Depot, Lowe's and others allow those of us who are medically exempt. They know the law and don't want to be sued for civil rights violations. I shop there all the time maskless and have no issues.   Places of public accommodation are forbidden to violate state and federal law. Not obeying the laws from ignorance or self righteousness doesn't change the law. Businesses can't make laws.   My suggestion is - get educated on your legal responsibilities if you own or run a business of public accommodation. Wanting to have your costumer's safety is admirable but when that crosses the line to breaking the law, that's a line nobody may cross.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: Unfortunately drove an hour and a half to find out they were closed for a sold out event.  We looked at the website before making the trip where there was no mention of this event.  Please update your website!

reviews.author: Kiki H.
reviews.description: The temporary location in Bee Cave is horrible. Very rude staff. Some beef jerk named M a t t is the reason I will never go back.  Tip: Don't waste your time or money for overpriced fruity flavored beer served with an attitude. There are plenty of other places within a few hundred feet at the Hill Country Galleria that provide better service than Vista Booing.

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Super cute, cozy, and clean BandB. One of the more reasonably priced places in Wimberley. Located right off the Square so easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the creek. I recommend Kiss the Cook (souvenirs, kitchen gadgets, coffee, etc) and Wimberley Cafe (good burgers and pie). The courtyard is beautifully decorated and relaxing. Plenty of FREE breakfast and pre-packaged snacks available even during COVID (cereal, Nutri-grain and Nature Valley bars, Chewy bars, muffins, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, pudding packs, fruit cups, yogurt, chips, milk and water for $1).  Stayed in the Maeson room. You have to exit the home into the courtyard to access this room, but I liked the privacy. Very comfortable king size bed, fresh linens, very spacious room w/ mini fridge, microwave, and tv, not much counter space in the bathroom though. Hosts were incredibly nice and welcoming. I would return!

reviews.author: Christina Z.
reviews.description: My sister got married last week in Wimberly, TX. Our family thought, "this is so random". Neither of the families lived there and most of us had never heard of Wimberly. Then my sister said she had booked us at The Square Inn and gave us room arrangements.   I had flown in leaving MD at 4 am then getting to Dallas and then drove an hour. It felt like it was 5 in the afternoon but in reality it was 11am.   We walk into the Square Inn and was greeted by the owners. It never even hit my mind from the crazy traveling, check in was at 3 PM. To be honest I didnt think about it till others said there hotels would not let them early check in.   When meeting the owners, it felt like family. It almost felt like we were all coming home. They were so great. They let us in early and was cool enough to say, "we need to run out before the others come, you are in charge."   The whole place was beautiful and amazing. Every room was perfect for single friends, to my other sisters and my crazy, but loveable nephews. Mr. Loyd one of the owners was like a natural grandfather with letting the boys run around but also telling them to close the door to keep AC inside. Lol  My favorite spot was the court yard. It looks like something out of a movie. Plus when it rains you can sit and watch the rain hit the roof. It's so peaceful.   So on top of a friendly, welcoming, beautiful space to stay and socialize, they also cook breakfast. Let me tell you it was the best food I have ever had at a bed and breakfast place.   We could smell the bacon at 6 am. Yum yum   So hands down this is place to stay in Wimberly. Its walking distance of all the cool shops and places to eat in town.

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Cons: * There were mosquitoes CONSTANTLY flying around our room. We never left the door open, so I don't know how they kept coming in. (This was the biggest con) * When we placed the "service our room" card on our door, no one ever came to fix the bed or resupply fresh towels. We were gone for like the whole day, and no one came, so that wasn't nice * The water pressure in the shower was too hard * The bathroom floor would get soaking wet anytime we took a shower because the curtain wouldn't stay closed all the way to prevent the water from going outside the tub. * When they gave us the wifi password they spelled it with a capital T, but really it was all lowercase, so we had a hard time getting the WiFi to work until we called the front desk.   Pros: * it is within walking distance to all the little stores and Wimberley cafe. * the staff is friendly. * The price of the room is reasonable   They just need to fix all the cons listed, and I think they would have a fine place to stay. Very unique and quirky. Also, I do think it would be nice if they had cable television.

reviews.author: Chelsie B.
reviews.description: Really neat place, would love to stay here again. Very clean and friendly folks. Peaceful and quite. About a 3 min walk to nearby restaurants and bars.

reviews.author: Arnold G.
reviews.description: Okay. We ended up in wimberley on the coldest days of the year for my wife's 50th birthday. We arrived on Thursday and joined by our two adult sons. We were lucky to have made reservations at the Square Inn.  This place is quaint and hip at the same time.  Our room/suite was large and clean and really comfy.  The staff and owners were great and accommodating. We had to leave early due to the weather so we really couldn't enjoy all of the amenities, but we r definitely going to return. The Square Inn is a great choice for being close to the Square. Lots of great places to walk to and enjoy. Can't wait to go back and we will absolutely b staying at the Square Inn. Thx for making our short stay so pleasurable.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: My sister and her husband stayed here while visiting from Spain. They loved Everything about it ,  especially the super comfy bed.  Breakfast was delicious

reviews.author: Peachy S.
reviews.description: Fun, quiet place to stay. Fantastic location. Owners were really friendly and the breakfasts were amazing. They even accommodated my dietary restrictions!! Definitely will be back!!

reviews.author: Kimberleigh S.
reviews.description: My man did very well finding this BandB for our short stay in Wimberley. I don't know which was better, the gracious hospitality of the owners' and their family or our very comfortable room. The breakfast, served from 0800-1000 is also awesome. We stayed in the "Lauren" room located by the back patio area. The entire establishment is quiet and clean and I loved having a mini fridge in the room. The Inn is centrally located and quaint shops and restaurants are right outside the door. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Chuck M.
reviews.description: Nice location just off the main square. Great location to explore the Wimberley area from.  Well kept, nicely appointed rooms. Owner is very attentive and courteous.  Excellent pricing, often lower than other BandB's in the area.  I stayed a night mid-week. If you want to stay over the weekend, make your reservations early. It often fills up on the weekend. My room was off the patio in the back, the patio was a nice place to relax.

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: The Square Inn was perfect for my husband and I's Anniversary Getaway.  The staff was very helpful and welcoming.  Wonderful breakfast served every morning with plenty of shopping steps away. Our room was warm and quaint - bathrooms with recent update and decor.  We loved that the BandB had 24 hour come and go as you need as we were attending a wedding outside of town. Each room felt like it had it's own private oasis as it faced in to a beautiful courtyard area to sit and drink your morning coffee or a glass of wine. We can't wait to visit Wimberley again and stay at this adorable little BandB!

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Fantastic! Feels just like Wimberley: quaint and welcoming! The room was spacious, very clean, and well cooled even during the hot summer sun. All the details were great: towels were fresh and soft, wifi was fast, bed was comfortable, shampoo was even great!   But the location was amazing! Right on the square, so my wife and I literally walked almost everywhere! If we needed to refresh our drink, we simply walked back to the room. No problem!   Now the food. Breakfast is served daily and is delicious! In addition, they have a great selection of coffees, teas, and cocoas! Snacks like chips, pound cake, muffins, granola bars, microwave popcorn, etc. were available all day.   Can't say enough good things about this gem! Wouldn't change a thing!

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to stay in wimberly. The couple the manage the BandB are charming and attentive. This place is like home and has a lovely covered patio. Short walking distance to shops and resturants. Very clean and tidy rooms with mini ref and microwave. A must stay at reasonable rates.

reviews.author: Stephaney G.
reviews.description: this is the worst service I've ever received at a bed and breakfast. They took 20 mins to show up at the front desk when we arrived. they are charging us for damages they refuse to show us documents of. i went back and forth emailing the so called staff there and she told me she didn't have time for my problems. when I asked for her bosses number she gave me her fiances number. which, big surprise was no help because he would only side with her. he said hes the gm and theirs no higher position then him which is a lit because every gm has a boss and while we were there a lady was talking to them about things they needed changed who i'm assuming is Marcilia B. the owner. also the couple who runs the place was arguing so loud while we were there we could hear it from our room, when i went to see what was going on i saw her yelling at him.There was NEVER anyone at the front desk the whole time we were there and they lied about their medicine variety they claim to have. I'm pregnant and can only have Tylenol which the claimed they had in their "large variety" which only consisted of off brand aspirin. when i emailed them asking for documents all they did was argue with me (a customer) instead of trying to resolve the problem. I don't recommend  to anyone to stay here or waste your money because you will only get horrible service. DO NOT GO HERE WASTE OF MONEY.

reviews.author: Renee G.
reviews.description: Loved this place it was perfect for our large family. The food was great for breakfast. The outdoor patio was so comfortable and amazing. Thanks for the lovely well decorated rooms and comfortable beds.

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I spent one night at the Square Inn. They were extremely accommodating even though we could only spend one night when they normally have a two night minimum. The room was very spacious,  decorated perfectly and very clean. The inn was fully booked but you wouldn't even know it because it was so nice and quiet. We felt as though we had the whole place to ourselves. The owners are so very nice and informative. The inn is walking distance to many shops and dining options. We weren't able to stay for breakfast but it smelled delicious. We will definitely be going back!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: A girlfriend and I recently stayed here one night and had a really nice time.  It was super clean and the inn keepers Keegan and Meg were very friendly hosts.  It was very quiet at night and our beds were very comfortable.  Also, you can't beat the location for walking to the shops and restaurants.

reviews.author: Jon R.
reviews.description: Myself and my fiancee recently visited Square Inn, and were very pleased with our stay.  The Lauren Room was clean, with warm, rustic interiors and a fabulously comfortable king-size bed.  The patio located just a few steps from our door was spacious; nice place to hang out before venturing to either Marco's Italian or Cypress Creek for dinner (both restaurants, by the way..  wonderful).  Square Inn is walking distance from some truly amazing dining, along with quaint knick knack shops (soaps, candy, etc.)-- not to mention you're swimming the Blanco, or tasting at Wimberley Valley Winery, in just a few minutes' drive.  Can't beat that.  Which reminds me: amenities included a big-screen t.v. in the common area, a decent library of DVD'S, an Xbox 360 game console with games, and complimentary wine in the afternoon and evenings.  Really, really nice being able to wind down for the night with a movie, and a glass or two from Duchman Winery.   Marci, our innkeeper at Square Inn, was very friendly, and courteous, even during a fluke front-door locking mechanism malfunction which resulted in our having to wake her up.

reviews.author: Blanca G.
reviews.description: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay.  Very cozy, quiet and comfortable.  Loved that it was walking distance to all the shops. The owners were very friendly!  Enjoyed our *Cowboy Casserole*!

reviews.author: Johnny j.
reviews.description: This is a quiet little place with 6 rooms.  The innkeeper, Marci, serves breakfast every morning in the common area.  According to her, this place is a labor of love, and it shows.  The beds are comfortable and the atmosphere is peaceful.  I will definitely be staying again next spring.  If you are visiting Wimberly for the Square, the inn is literally a stone's throw away.

reviews.author: Marcus M.
reviews.description: Wow, an incredible find. Really great Texas wine using their own estate-grown grapes. Highly recommend taking a trip into the Texas hill country for this great family vineyard and winery.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: First, the Driftwood Bistro is on the grounds of Driftwood Estates winery, just off RR 12 south of Dripping Springs. There are several things to be said about that. First, be prepared for the rough, rocky driveway up the hill to the grounds. Once on top, though, the vista is splendid, especially as the sunset rolls across the hills beyond and the flats below. The grounds are lovely and spacious and pleasing. It is an exceedingly pleasing setting.  Beyond that, the Bistro is on one side of the hilltop and the wine house on the other. The Bistro doesn't have a liquor license, so you have to walk across the grounds to get a glass or bottle to go with your meal. An inconvenience. Their wines are middle of the road, and the selection of wines by the glass are very limited as far as whites go.  The Bistro has a pretty experimental and ambitious menu, with creative choices and options. We had the Caribbean Shrimp and Rice and the Open-faced Stuffed Avocado. The avocado dish was superb, with the featured avocado just the right level of ripeness, tender grilled chicken and a picante that was dynamite. The salsa Fresca and crema helped create a very satisfying entre. The flavors both blended and contrasted with each other. A very nice choice of a cool dish for a summer evening. The shrimp dish, on the other hand, was disappointing. It was tepid, to start with. And the shrimp had a very fishy flavor. The sautéed squash was credible, but overall it was disappointing.   Service was cordial. Lexi,our server, was very warm and welcoming and attentive. It was not her fault that the shrimp wasn't the proper temperature   The Bistro gets a 'maybe' on this visit, with hopes that they will improve on speed out of the kitchen and address that glitchy separation of wine bar and restaurant. The place has much going for it, and, if they can up their game, it will be a killer destination.

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: The food trucks have some great options and the beer and wine selection is pretty extensive. However what really sells it is the whole vibe! The staff is super friendly, the view is outstanding and there's even a play area for the kiddos. My son spent about 3 hours playing and blissfully out of my hair and off the iPad! We will definitely be ba

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: This place was pretty spectacular. I've been wanting to go for a while and it finally happened! It was in the low 70s and perfect weather. The hill country views are beautiful and I'd imagine sunsets here are gorgeous. Outdoor games available. Dogs on leash are allowed.   Lots of seating and an interesting idea on how to hold your seats/table. It was nice not having to worry about somebody taking our spot while playing with the animals. You can also get food for them at the bar. They were pretty gentle and didn't mind selfies.   Lots of beer, cider and wine options. I had the sweet Sangria (Messina Hof) and Cherry Cobbler by Martin House. Both delightful and fruity.   They have 2 food trucks: Gringas Grub Shak and Kelly's Hill Country BBQ. I went with Kelly's and got the Brisket Elote Parfait and it was so, so good. I want to go back just for that! There were so many options to choose from. There's really something for everyone. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: THE BIG: Scenic brewery that overlooks Texas Hill Country...with a llama and donkeys!  THE BLACK AND WHITE: I thought this place was a brewery but a brewpub will do! Plenty of great drinks on tap as well as friendly bartenders.   The bae and I came here after a swim at the neighboring Blue Hole Regional Park. Short 11min drive will get you to Shady Llama from Blue Hole.  The star of the show is the petting zoo featuring the llama and two donkeys. You can get up and personal with the llama by feeding and petting. I was a little hesitant to get too close because who knows if he'll spit.  The view of Texas Hill Country is breathtaking and you could sit here for hours just taking it all in. There were two food trucks on site offering tacos and bbq.  THE FINAL BAMBOO: The vibe here was so nice. Great place to unwind after long day at the pool or chill with friends until dusk.

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: After a long dip at Blue Hole Regional Park, the Shady Llama is a place to go for a quick bite, beer, and incredible views. As soon as you walk in, the chairs and hammocks out provide a nice campfire style vibe. There are a ton of trees to keep you cool, and the view of Hill Country is one of a kind. To your right, there is a small fence with adorable llama's you can feed and pet. I didn't get to try the food, but the bbq smelled incredible.  Lots of beer and wine options, and great place to bring your friends for a relaxing afternoon.

reviews.author: Brett R.
reviews.description: Perfect place to kick back, relax, and enjoy the beautiful Central Texas weather. So simple but relaxing. Kid friendly atmosphere. Exactly what I hoped to find!

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a brew pub with a lovely outdoor space, expansive Hill Country views, and entertainment for all!  | Experience | You can't beat it!  It the best of what the area wineries offer in terms of a place where you want to spend a leisurely couple of hours, with a great assortment of local craft beers on tap (and options for the non-beer drinkers).  I like that there is a variety of seating options (picnic tables, Adirondack chairs, barstools) and they are nicely spread out.  Aside from the view the main attraction is their resident llamas and mini donkeys, and trust me, splurge on the bag of feed for optimal up-close interaction with these adorable camelids!  | Beverages | A nicely curated selection of local beer on tap, and surely something to please everyone.  There's also a selection of cider, hard seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages.    | Eats | We didn't eat here, but there's an onsite resident food trailer offering tacos, quesadillas and burgers.

reviews.author: April L.
reviews.description: Cute beer garden nestled in the wimberly hills! They have a huge selection of beer and some food trucks. It is very family friendly and the llamas are so sweet! Be sure to ask the bar for some llama food the feed them.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: A friend invited me to The Shady Llama on a Sunday afternoon. Such a wonderful place! Great for hanging out with friends. The check in is nice, you tell them how many people are in your party and they give you a table sign to reserve your spot. The beer selection is local. Wine is local as well. The llamas are an extra treat to see. You can purchase feed at the bar. The view of the valley and hill country is fantastic. This is a great place for groups, dogs and is kid friendly too.  All staff members are friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: What a perfect place to enjoy a relaxed few hours on a nice weather day in the Hill Country! The Shady Llama, just west of Wimberley on the way toward Dripping Springs on RR12 is a gem of a yard bar offering Texas-based craft brews, soft drinks, and wines with a killer view and a few furry mascots to feed and pet.  Our family loves this place. We can each enjoy a tasty beverage we like, have a good lunch from the Gringa's truck we like from Wimberley, and feed some alfalfa to some llamas and burros.  There are plenty of socially-distanced places to lounge around the terraced and tree-shaded yard, and everything is outdoors. It's actually perfect for pandemic times.  Pro-tip: do not try to come here during any weekend with special events in Wimberley, like Market Days or Rodeo. The parking lot has limited capacity. Lazy Sundays are the best time IMHO.

reviews.author: Cayla G.
reviews.description: We were milling about in Wimberley and wanted to find a relax, safe spot to go enjoy the sunshine so we went to The Shady Llama. It exceeded our expectations! The beer selection had at least 10 on draft and another 15 or so canned. We loved the socially distant setting, the polite staff, the llamas, and the music! I'd love to come back here when I'm in Wimberley again! Note, I cannot review the food trailer on site as I only had the beers!  P.s. the Tang IPA from Rough Diamond is 5

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Judging from the recent reviews, I guess I'm in the minority. But I miss pre-COVID Shady Llama.  It's just not the same and the magic is gone. Given that literally 100% of the place is outside,  their COVID protocols are way over the top.   Why do you need to assign picnic tables??   And all the hammocks are gone (risk of transmission is greater from canvas than wood??).  At least they stopped doing the inane requirement of reservations they were doing for a while.   So if you're uber paranoid and love restricted freedoms maybe it won't be an issue for you.    But it just made my wife and I sad to be back (1st time in a year and pre-pandemic we were regulars).   Yes they have good beer, and higher prices now to offset the fact that people obviously aren't flocking there like they used to.  And the view is great and it's fun to see the llamas and if you never went before maybe you'll be none the wiser.  But for me it's just a sad reminder of what it used to be and a testament to how much fear and paranoia have all but ruined our country.   I won't be back until they restore everything to pre-pandemic protocols.

reviews.author: J J.
reviews.description: What a fun experience in lovely Wimberley.  Good selection of craft beer, some wine and non alcoholic drinks too like apple cider, hot chocolate.  Beautiful setting. Catch the sunset.  The Llamas were fun to watch as well. We went twice in one weekend because missed the llamas the first night must see

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Just all sorts of whimsical in brewery form.  Their table designation decor they give you at the front so you can claim your spot without fear of anyone scooping it up when you're grabbing a beer or going to gawk at the llamas or mini donkeys is adorbs and shows attention to detail and a winning customer service experience right off the bat.   The tables are spread out nicely and there's plenty of shaded options or exposed ones, depending on your tolerance for the sun/heat.   It's actually on top of a hill so you can get a lovely panoramic vista of Hill Country, so you better believe if you're there at sunset, you'll be getting a gorgeous setting to close out on.   They don't brew their own beer (or wine), so they offer up a glimpse of Texas' finest on tap, which I appreciate. During COVID, every order came with chips or a treat (from a Costco assortment), but there's also a taco truck in the back if you're looking for something a little more substantive.   Kid and dog friendly, and since there are cute animals roaming the grounds (but fenced away from the tables), there are a lot more kids also roaming the grounds, so if that's not your thing, this may not be the place for you ;)  They have 6 llamas and two mini donkeys, and while the guy checking us in made it seem a sighting of them is rare unless you get there right when they open because that's when feeding time is, they were ever present during our midday visit. You can purchase feed for $1/bag to lure them over, and so I have a feeling we just had an extra generous crowd that day that always kept them fence curious!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came on a weekday evening and had a glass of rose. Was disappointed to find that the llamas had already retired for the day and usually come out during the mornings. However, the scenery was picturesque, and I loved the overall charm of the outdoor space. Service was on point.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Loved our visit here! Cute animals, yummy beverages, and tons of outdoor seating- our kinda place! I'd be here all the time if it was closer to Austin :)

reviews.author: Siobhan D.
reviews.description: This place was amazing, friendly and attentive staff, a huge place to hangout and get together, food trucks , etc. it wasn't super busy when we went and by sunset more people arrived to enjoy the wonderful views. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Eloy G.
reviews.description: Visited this place while passing by from the zip lines in Wimberley! This place a nice bar to just chill and have a nice cold beverage while gathering around with friends and enjoying the nice hill country scenery. The added bonus was being able to see the lamas on the property! That was pretty cool! Definitely stop by if you are in the area! This is a nice hangout for sure!

reviews.author: C. S.
reviews.description: What a cool place!!! Had several drinks and great dinner from the food truck. The llamas and donkeys came up while we were there so we got to feed them.

reviews.author: Jordan D.
reviews.description: Surprise! Not only does it have a great view and fluffy llamas, it's also a beer garden this was our saving grace after finding out that Jacobs Well was closed. We enjoyed some fantastic Texas brews  #cheers

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's shady. As in the trees provide shade, not the mob runs the place.   They have llamas. And beer. And fire pits. And picnic tables, lounge chairs, bar games, a view, and food trucks. And some miniature donkeys.   Pretty good food trucks. Pretty good beer. Pretty good venue.   A little off the beaten path, but not so far out of the way that we won't be back.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!!!  Very quiet and gorgeous area!!  Check them out!  Beautiful!!  Surrounded by trees and sounds of nature!  Free popcorn and dogs are welcome!

reviews.author: Chad B.
reviews.description: Beautiful brewery in Hill Country, Texas! Live music on weekends. Plentiful picnic table seating outdoors.  I had a chocolate chip cookie which was fresh and not too sweet!  The nachos had fresh chopped beef--similar texture to brisket or pastrami. Liquid nacho cheese is very warm.   None of the food was exceptional, but down home good.   Great place for a lazy weekend afternoon!

reviews.author: Mandy N.
reviews.description: As good as it gets!! I have always loved their farmhouse ales (Ona is probably my favorite dark saison in existence but I'm also so happy about their lager program starting up.   It's great to have refreshing approachable pilsners for people that aren't quite ready to walk on the (beer) wild side. If you're ready to go a little wild I definitely suggest their cave aged beer (the premiere has a little funkyness but it's not too crazy, like overripefruit and sourdough bread) we loved it and it feels really fun to pop a cork out in the texas sunshine.   You can always count on Roughhouse to make something creative and unique and if you come to the taps with an open mind you definitely won't be disappointed. They have beers to go in bottles and cans too which is lucky bc some of the high abv ones are really the best (but I can't have them before driving, ha!!)   Great food for snacking, we got a bbq sandwich and really liked the bbq sauce, we ended up getting extra so we could dip our chips in it lol  The setting is hard to beat, plenty of shade outside with abundant picnic tables, plus there is an air conditioned loft if you just can't handle the heat!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and peaceful place! I was weary of trying it since the beer sounded very floral, but there is something for everyone! I love the shaded outdoor picnic tables, and there is even a fire pit for s'mores ($3 to buy the kit)! The beer is delicious and fresh and they have a menu of farm to table foods. My husband and I tried the salsa (made from the goodies in their on-site garden) and it is the best I've had with the right amount of heat. We were able to buy a quart of it to take home- yummy!  This is definitely a great place to hangout with the pups and to get some fresh, countryside air while enjoying an acoustic band and some fresh beer served by the friendliest people.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: The food was underwhelming.  I was hoping it would be so good. The people were friendly. Good service.  Great atmosphere. Hope to come back for live music and maybe try a different app. Enjoyed the night even though food was unimpressive.

reviews.author: Carolyn V.
reviews.description: The Good:   :: local business!   :: lots of parking   :: lots of space outdoors. in these pandemic times we live in, this is critical to ensure safety and still let you enjoy yourselves   :: lots of outdoor seating options. picnic tables/benches galore   :: outdoor performance stage   :: charming outdoor lights to make the place twinkle   :: outdoor mini rock wall for kids to stay busy   :: great beers! very refreshing. if you don't know what you want, ask them for recommendations   :: great snacks/food options to accompany your beer   :: very clean bathrooms   :: very good pandemic procedures for safety  The Bad:   :: none  The Ugly:   :: none  Would I go back? When I'm in this area of town again, I'll absolutely make my way here for a drink and a snack and to relax.   This place is IN.

reviews.author: Casey B.
reviews.description: What's that saying...?...too much of a good thing? No, I got it: don't drink bad beer.   Admittedly, my hop-soaked beer taste buds may not be par with a more astute beer connoisseur, but bad beer is bad beer. Tis a shame: this place is a true retreat. The Austin-indie-jazz duo provided an eclectic sound which paired perfectly with this serene outdoor haven.   Their flight card/cart is cool...it's dog friendly....there's a cactus.  The point is, what can you do when the beer's bad but move on and find another place.   I'm also slightly irked when businesses refuse legal tender.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: Been many times, and tried many of the Roughhouse beers. Every time was a pleasure. The staff are super friendly and flexible, and I love that the outdoor patio is dog-friendly. Glad to see they're growing and building more outdoor seating. Hope they'll continue to grow and do well!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: We were thrilled to find a local craft brewery that was open - so much of this area is still closed or offering limited service. The beer is good, the employees are friendly, and the venue offers socially distanced picnic tables under some nice shade trees. There was live entertainment when we visited. Great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: A group of us drove in to get some beers on a hot early evening/late afternoon after shopping at San Marcos Outlets. And if you're debating whether or not to make that drive--do it. You're welcome.  Roughhouse has THE space, service-oriented people backing it up AND...(the most important part for all of us beer nerds) a delicious lineup of their own beers. We drove in and were surprised to find that it was tucked in at the end of this residential street. There is plenty of space here though--it gave us Jester King and TX Keeper Cider vibes with the "outback" far out drive that make you feel like you've escaped the busy city/town life. Parking is abundant in the gravel area, and from the moment you arrive you know it's going to be a wholesome good time.  We could hear the live band out there that day, and we saw people with their dogs and kids. So awesome when breweries allow all people and furry friends! There's a kitsch pickup truck out front and a huge wooden cottage-like space that is the microbrewery. The interior feels much more quaint and modern, so get out your hipster glasses and handkerchiefs, millenials! I enjoyed my flight of beers for $12. My favorite beers were Treeform IPA and Floral Print. I ended up taking a Treeform home, and the label is so tastefully done with an earthy and spritely flavor.   We also ordered burgers (that come with mac and cheese! SO ooey gooey), and I gotta say their black bean veggie burger was not bad. I'm critical of veggie burgers because most people just slap it on the grill and that's it...or they just give you a thick piece of Portobello between two slices of bread. Not at Roughhouse! We also enjoyed a game of cornhole and can confirm they also have large Jenga. They have clean restrooms and serve-yourself water. Wifi is strong and it's a guaranteed a good time. Will definitely be back. Can't wait to see them grow and expand in the community.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Loved the outdoor space and entertainment . Not a big drinker so can not comment on the beer but other guests seemed to enjoy themselves. It is a bit out of town yet that contributes to its uniqueness. If you like non-traditional American food then you will like the menu and can try something new and tasty.

reviews.author: Meredith Z.
reviews.description: Pleasantly satisfied with our lunch here. We got a pastrami sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich. The wagyu beef in pastrami sandwich was particularly good!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: The beer is good but the food is great.  There was this lamb sausage that was outstanding.  A little in the spicey side but just enough not to burn.  It came with chips and pickled mixed veggies.   Yummmmy

reviews.author: Nicci C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, really good beers, and dog friendly! What more could you ask for? Highly recommend the queso with pork.

reviews.author: Captain G.
reviews.description: Service A1, view A1, method for COVID A1, environment is beautiful except for experiment 625 and 626. Worst experiments...

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Very nice brewery. Not a fan of farmhouse ales but, they are actually pretty good what they have on tap.   Love the upstairs hangout.   Suggestions- The place is in the boonies. Food specials or something to entice people to come in would be good.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Ben M.
reviews.description: Roughhouse Brewing is the cutest husband and wife brewing company in Texas!   If you're in the San Marcos area, this is a great place to spend the day drinking some delicious farm-style beer, wine and ciders in an absolutely gorgeous wooden barn.   The building alone is worth the drive, but the Treeform IPA is what kept me smiling ear to ear! One of the best IPAs I've ever had.   Our Saturday trip included some really nice tunes by a local acoustic guitar player on the stage in the backyard. We had a very large group in town for a funeral, and there was plenty of seating outside for us all and the staff was incredibly accommodating, offering everyone samples since we were all first timers.   We don't make it out to San Marcos often, but this will definitely be a place we visit every chance we can. Great job! We wish you nothing but the best!!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: Great beer, excellent food and service. We've enjoyed the live entertainment, loft and fire pit too. Frequent beer releases are incentive to return. We will be back!

reviews.author: Robyn L.
reviews.description: Seemed a little out of the way, but most certainly worth the trip. Great property and atmosphere. Wish it had not been so hot and we could have enjoyed the outdoors. We enjoyed flights of beer and overall the quality of the beer was really good. Pretzel appetizer with cheese sauce and mustard was a terrific accompaniment. Staff was very informed and friendly, we had a great visit.

reviews.author: Jess H.
reviews.description: Absolutely everything you want in a brewery.... even if you're with people who don't want beer! Great food, great beer, wine, and ciders. This place is gorgeous with great spaces- cozy upstairs, picnic tables outside, live music, and kid friendly spaces. Everything we tasted including a lot of the menu was delicious. This place makes San Marcos and a Wimberly look goooooood. Pay em a visit. You'll love the vibe. You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great spot along the brewery trail in dripping springs. Lots of outdoor seating, live music and the beer is pretty good as well. They have food trucks so you can pick up a snack if you're hungry. Definitely a stop if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: Great out of the way right off the beaten path. It wasn't on our map to go to but did not disappoint.  We revisited and the bartender remembered us from two days prior, even what we drank. This is place is definitely worth the stop. Next trip to town we will be dropping in.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: This brewery is not like any other. It's a beautiful property with an amazing selection of beverages. We had the Texas Sun (saison), the Hilco (California Common), and the Texas Keeper Cider. All were phenomenal and suited to each of our tastes. The folks working here are the best. Thelma is an absolute sweetheart. (She and her husband own it). We are looking forward to attending the grand opening later this month and watching Ghost Note Brewing mature and prosper into the success we know it will be.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Super chill, super laid back brewery.   They have a stage for music (starts later on the weekends), a food truck slinging burgers, fries, and shishito peppers!  There's also a venue on property to celebrate special occasions.  Beer is good. Flights available so you can try a bunch. Only feature their brews; no guest beers.  Not a ton of shade, so when it gets hot, not sure it's the best place to be exposed to the unrelenting Texas heat!

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: This was my first visit and it was amazing. The staff is very friendly! The place is very spacious. Very thankful for the staff wearing masks and gloves. There was a sign encouraging people to wear masks when they are not at the area they are sitting. Which is awesome. The beer is delicious. Recommend the Imperial Stout. The food truck that is on site has good food choices! The place is worth a stop if your are in the area.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: This is the cutest little place ever!! Absolutely gorgeous. There is so much space- so many little cozy seating areas. Outside heaters for when it's cold, giant industrial fans for when it's hot. I'm so glad we stopped in. The owners were fantastic and great to talk to, and the drinks were equally great. Can't wait to go back for another visit.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Great beer and an even better atmosphere. Live music on the Sunday we came. Beautiful set up.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: Of the local breweries this has the best beer. Recommend the Amber ale and the imperial stout

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: Love the atmosphere here.  I tried the Pilsner and it was great.   Beautiful grounds and tons of seating.    I just ordered burgers from the food truck

reviews.author: Blade S.
reviews.description: First visit to Ghost Note and was very impressed!  Tasty beer - nice outdoor layout with plenty of properly spaced tables and friendly staff.  Very much appreciated the staff wearing masks while serving customers and sanitizing the tables in between customers.  Tried the 4 beer flight and enjoyed them all.  Reasonably priced beer choices as well which was nice. Will be back!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: Amazing beer and a cool place to hang out.  Big tables with QR code's and window service.  They have a food truck, family and dog friendly.  Fans and heaters depending on the weather, mellow fun music and great service!  Go here before it gets crowded

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Tried ghost note for the first time today. I shall be back. Beautiful setting in the hill country outside of dripping Springs. Nice, standard selection of 10 brews. Good service and live music. The "hangry" food truck was outstanding! Try their smash burger, parm truffle fries, blistered shishito peppers and especially the hot dog with bacon and sauerkraut. Delicious!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: Good beer selection, good food truck, nice atmosphere, glad they had space heaters. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a fabulous hang out!  We hung out on the roof!  Food truck has yummy burgers and DELISH tator tots! Wine selection is small but the Cupcake Chardonnay isn't too bad!  Just a bit outside San Mo - cute place!  Live music!!!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Beer seems to be hit or miss. But overall it's a great atmosphere, dog friendly (even fenced areas for them to roam). The road is sort of loud, but it's a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The food truck is incredible! The burgers are great and the tots are extra crispy and perfect!

reviews.author: Rita K.
reviews.description: Our first time and we loved it! Adored the burgers - really hit the spot. The fried pickles were amazing. Beers were also great and staff was helpful and accommodating- your dog is welcome! Chill vibe.

reviews.author: Kaitlin B.
reviews.description: This place is total trash. Don't eat here if you are starving to death. I asked them to at least melt the cheese on the tots and it was the end of the world. They were rude and their food is gross.

reviews.author: Bridget S.
reviews.description: Loved Middleton before COVID, managed to still support them during, and am delighted to be back now that we're on the road back. They spent the pandemic brewing up some tasty new beers to add to their already delicious standards, I think Good might have replaced Third Coast as my favorite while Evil has supplanted my husband's usual Juicy Visions. And have to give a shout-out to the edition of the Burger Truck--wonderful, especially the bacon/Brussels sprout combo (I know, sounds weird but so good!). We were so worried about our local hang-outs surviving the pandemic and couldn't be happier that Middleton not only survived but is coming back stronger than ever.

reviews.author: Jorge S.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a very nice facility. Staff was friendly and they do allow dogs. It was a little to hot outside to enjoy their roof top patio area.

reviews.author: Rebeca G.
reviews.description: The COVID precautions are great! Tables are spread out indoors as well as in outdoor seating. I was impressed with the table cards that help guest determine if tables are clean or in need of cleaning. Overall very clean space.   As it relates to the atmosphere, like mentioned kept very clean, and customer service is great. Service was great inside was helped decide what drinks to get and given samples of a few to help make decisions. Service was also great outside with the food truck.   For the quality and experience the price for everything was great! The beers taste amazing and the kombucha was fantastic. The burgers were very tasty. Best burgers I've had in a long time.   A sight you just see for yourself!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I'm going to get this out of the way real quick.  There was a cat walking around on the bar.  Yes, you heard me.  ON THE BAR.  I knew it was a dog friendly place, but come on - a cat ON the bar?  It even walked over to my side of the bar, sat down, put its leg behind its head like cats do, and then proceeded to lick its butt in front of me.  Hey cat, I'm really impressed that you can do that, but you're not getting a tip from me.  The staff member that it belonged to shooed it away, but it stayed on the bar.  Subtract one star for this show.  Next up:  As I said, it's dog friendly.  VERY dog friendly.  There were two dogs belonging to customers roaming around freely inside the place.  A third dog was on a leash, but it kept barking at the other dogs.  This wasn't outside on the patio, this was all inside.  When I go somewhere to hang out and relax, I don't want to deal with barking dogs (in my book, it's akin to bringing screaming kids into a bar).  Subtract one star for letting the dogs inside.  Keep the cats and dogs *outside* and this would be a five star brewery to chillax at.    Beer:  They have a decent selection of brews and like most breweries, they have some permanent ones and some seasonals that rotate in and out.  They have five or six store bought wines available.  Staff:  VERY knowledgeable about their beer and can suggest something for you once you describe your taste palette to them.  Food:  The food truck out front is permanently hitched up here, the one in the back changes occasionally.    Plenty of seating inside and outside, there's even a spacious deck on the second floor.  Growler refills are $14 and crowlers are $9.40 (buy three crowlers and get 10 percent off).  If your selection is over 8 percent ABV, additional charges may apply.   One more note about the dogs and I'll put this puppy to bed.  There's a fenced off area downstairs to let your dogs run rampant in - put them in there instead of bringing them inside - or better yet, leave them at home.  This whole thing with people bringing their dogs everywhere is getting out of hand.    I was going to give them two solid stars, but now that I think about it, if they let cats run back and forth across their bars, how clean is their brewing process?  It's a cool place with good brews, and I want to like it, but when I think about the animals everywhere, I think twice about what might be in the beer.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Nice spot floor brews and live music. I was told that the food trucks are good.  Maybe next time.    Suggestions- Check music lineup. Surprisingly older crowd spot.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Was hoping to love this place, but we were pretty disappointed with the beer selection... Love the space and the dog friendliness! Plus we heard the food truck was awesome! But the beers just really fell short... Maybe we are a little too spoiled living in Austin around so many amazing breweries

reviews.author: Jasmine G.
reviews.description: I'm giving this place one star for the burger truck. Our beers were good and I like the atmosphere inside. The guy in the burger truck was SO rude. The table next to us also had multiple issues with their orders that they were loudly complaining about. I asked for the loaded tots with no beef and he said he couldn't ring them up that way. We weren't asking for a discount, just remove the beef???? So then he said to get regular tots and add cheese and onions/jalapeños. What did we get? Plain tots. He was also so fricking unfriendly. The table next to us retired a burger that had the bun top black/burned, and apparently he complained about redoing it. Brewery needs to rethink this employee.

reviews.author: Benjamin B.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time in 6+ years on a quiet night. Jimmy made our vacation sweet as hell and took the best care of us possible. Good conversation and great beers. Glad to know this place has only gotten better since college. Keep killing it, guys.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Middleton is a must if you're stopping by or even in the general area.  We were driving from Wimberley (a fun day at Jacob's Well) towards the San Marcos outlets, and had to double back even to come to Middleton! We were so glad we did. My bf even walked out with their peach crowler...just a warning though, bring a cooler of some sort so it doesn't explode in your car with the heat! Totally speaking from personal experience, sadly.  We shared two rounds of tasters, which come with 5 different selections. So come with friends and try them all! You'll be surprised at how delicious they all are. Middleton is also HEAVEN for Belgian lovers. Good thing we love Belgians. Little did I know that a microbrew outside of Austin would be a great place for craft Belgians. I'm an all-around beer lover--everything except saisons, NE pale ales, and lagers, whereas the bf is a Belgian enthusiast. He always goes for Belgians. So you can imagine why we decided to get a taste of everything Belgian. I also enjoyed their Easy Ride PA, but was not a fan of the chile IPA (to each their own). It was almost impossible for me to compare and contrast the beer quality to the all-around atmosphere of the place. It oozes joy and love--they have brew dogs (and customers can bring doges too) who basically just lie around and nap, PLUS they have popcorn that is self-serve from those tiny machines that you see in Disneyland and other carnival events.  Will definitely be back to Middleton. Clean restrooms, and large space indoors for bigger groups (WITH TV's!) and cool fun outdoors games like human jenga outside. There is plenty of parking in their private loose, gravel parking area, and they had a food truck parked right outside. Awesome spot, great beer, fantastic space!

reviews.author: Cesar R.
reviews.description: Heading to the Texas hill country? Love beer? Make sure to stop at Middleton Brewery!  I will confess I am not a huge beer lover but my friends are and were raving about this place so we  stopped by to watch the Euro Cup game between Germany and Italy.  The brewery is well design with great bar space and patio area. Dogs are welcome so bring your pup, children not so much ;-).   Step up to the bar and build your own beer flight you get five picks of 2-3 ounces each for $12. There wasn't a beer I didn't like! From the Porter to the American Red there were all good!   Live band was great and the two flat screens more than met our soccer watching needs.  So if your looking for a place to get your hops fix in the Texas Hill Country this is it!

reviews.author: Steve K.
reviews.description: A MUST for anyone looking for an essential hill country experience. Delicious beer in a variety of styles. Wonderful atmosphere.   2 world famous brewery mascots; Pinky the dog (as white and large as Gandalf's horse). Dunkel the cat (omnipresent and all-knowing)  Dunkel is the sweetest cat and deserves to be in the brewery hall of fame. Some heartless punk in the reviews below complained about Dunkel. This same guy has a Lonestar beer as his profile pic, so at least we know he has ZERO brewery review credibility.   As a result Dunkel's been banned from the taproom. So, Thank you, Lonestar bro, for driving out from your big city to a enchanting, rural, authentic hill country brewery and complaining about an animal for no good reason.   Knowing the type of compassionate, animal-loving people who frequent this place, I'm sure we can rally together to #FREEDUNKEL.

reviews.author: Lindsay J.
reviews.description: Didn't have a drink, but stopped in for the experience...It is a very cool vibe!!! Singing, dancing, drinking on a Friday night = Perfection!  I was jealous I couldn't stay. If only I lived in the Hill Country, I would do this all the time. There was a live band.  There is a dance floor. There are two food trucks. And, there is plenty of beer to try. The location is between Wimberley, Canyon Lake and San Marcos...As the Hill Country grows, places love me this are a great option for all those migrating South!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: My wife and I took my cousin and his wife for a visit on a quiet weekend. My wife and I are avid animal lovers and thus it's hard to describe our feelings about this place. On entering, there were numerous dogs wandering around and a cat walking across the bar, and after we sat down there were animal feces and urine on the floor. Needless to say, this was offputting to our group. Unfortunately, we did not notice the animal waste until we had already ordered. The service was average and somewhat lackluster. Nobody checked on us after we ordered our beer. As for the beer, it was good quality craft beer but nothing stood out at us. Take him away the issues with the animal waste, we still would not have found this an impressive venue and probably would not return. This is truly a shame, given the place's 4.5-star reviews on Yelp.

reviews.author: Tawnya V.
reviews.description: Went to Middleton Brewery, it was a lot of fun.  The beer was great and the staff was very nice.  They have the floor marked off for social distancing while waiting in line to get your beer.  There was a plexiglass in front of the bartender and the card reader was placed so you put it in the reader to pay and the bartender does not have to touch it.  All the tables inside and outside were at least 6 feet apart and the walkway was set up so you did not have to walk by any tables.  The brewery was very clean and I felt very safe there with this pandemic we have going on.

reviews.author: Priscilla Y.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop here on our road trip to San Antonio. The beers we got were really good and it seemed like a fun atmosphere. The bsrtenders were friendly. They have an outdoor patio out front and also an awesome rooftop deck. Free popcorn! They don't sell food, but there is a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Good spot to relax and unwind. They have complimentary popcorn, games such as Monopoly, Cards Against Humanity, etc. It's a dog friendly environment with open mic night from 6-9 on Mondays. (Which was the day of my visit). We were helped by Josh. He gave us nice recommendations about beer pairings/tastings.

reviews.author: Amy N.
reviews.description: We love Twisted x. The beer is great and so is the atmosphere. They have a large outdoor patio with heaters and indoor tables too. They have food trucks although they were not open when we were there. We will be back!

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: A group of friends and I came here on a Friday afternoon.   We got a couple flights of beer and really enjoyed them.   The staff was friendly, the place was clean and the decor was neat.   I would go back.

reviews.author: Alex L.
reviews.description: Nice location with a fair selection. Nothing special going on but a relaxing time. Will stop back in passing but may not spend a day there

reviews.author: shea w.
reviews.description: Had a great time here at Christmas time with our kids! They had activities for the kids and Santa was there. We grabbed our drinks and sat by a fire pit and relaxed while the kids ran around.  The musician who was playing was absolute wonderful (solo guitar and vocals). The staff was friendly and accommodating. I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Bob H.
reviews.description: First time here, indoor and outdoor seating, walk up service, food truck with pizza. Beverage selection: beer, soft drinks and some drink creations they make from their beers. Beer selection was over a dozen, about half  were IPAs. No porters, no stouts, especially for this time of year.  Overall sampling of selections was nothing to rave about, very little body and no depth in flavor. Bar staff was polite and busing the entire place. Unisex bathrooms need regular attention, bar staff should not have to do that too.  Overall impression: we won't drive to Dripping for Twisted X as a destination in the future.

reviews.author: Sue C.
reviews.description: Horrible customer service!  Their payment system did not work. They wanted to swipe the credit card multiple times. We refused. Offered to pay cash, they said no.    They wanted to write the credit card information on a piece of paper with other customers CC info. We refused.   Sidney, said that my attitude was not good. Sorry, Sidney you are not good at this business.  Your problem is not our problem.  Will not return all due to a horrible experience from Sidney.

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Pretty good beer and they have lots of activities, however the seating is pretty difficult. There's very few inside/under the roof and the rest are outside with the sun blaring down on us. They have umbrellas for the sun but they're disconnected from the table and there are only a few. Dog friendly!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Just 11 miles from Jester King, sits another awesome brewery, Twisted X. Good brewery ambience with both indoor and outdoor seating.  A food truck offering tacos and other Mexican snacks is parked on the premises.    Beer offerings are good with a varied selection.  Available on the day we visited, was chupaHOPra IPA, Mango IPA, Oatmeal Stout, Zwickle, Pilsner, Lager, Pale Ale and a few guest beers.  Flights available, $2 a taster for a very generous pour. Good flavor profiles to the ones we sampled.  2 bathrooms available. Out of toilet paper and not very clean on the day we were there.  Dogs are welcome, however, the outside seating area isn't huge.  Cornhole outside and the COOLEST carved tree you have ever seen!  Worth a stop and a beer just to appreciate the giant gargoyle and sombrero-wearing iguana.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I think this place is mainly for the atmosphere. My husband and I stopped by on our random "pub crawl" of the Hill Country. I can't say I had had Twisted X beer before (or maybe I have and it wasn't memorable). The location is nice and quiet, with a ton of outdoor seating. However, the sewage smell was overwhelming! The inside was large and open but was crowded and was so loud. I don't know- I was impressed with the building, but not the beer, and definitely not the smell.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time at Twisted X. Loved it so much.  Starting off the drive out there is beautiful. I love getting out to dripping springs and getting out of the city. The leaves are changing and it's just a wonderful drive through hill country  We got there and were greeted with friendly faces. We got a few beers then went on a tour. Very cool behind the scenes look of how they do everything in house!  Came back and told the bar manager we trusted him to put together a flight for us. And he delivered. All the beers were delicious.   We very much so enjoyed our time there! We also enjoyed that there is a food truck serving delicious pizzas! Daniele' did great!!

reviews.author: Matt L.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great beer and great location it's my favorite brewery in Austin! The MConahazzee is my jam! And all there other beers are great too! Great lil drive out the back roads from Austin to get there!

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: OK, I am admittedly late to the Twisted X party - which is sad - particularly for a S. Austi like myself. I really have no good excuse.   This day at the Brewery was cool and so sitting outside was great - as was the beers. This is such a great space, and the service here was fantastic. They also had someone playing acoustic guitar - which only added MORE to the cool factor.   I can see spending many more days here in my future.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: One of my favorite hill country breweries for both their beer and vibe. On the Sunday that we visited it was too darn hot to enjoy their patio even with their Big Ass Fan. Inside was cool and comfy as we ordered a couple of their taproom only specialty brews and enjoyed the live music. A shoutout to the guitar player who finished his set with a great Spanish guitar-led song.   So bring the mutt and your kiddos (there is plenty of room for both them to run around outside) and enjoy a few of their wonderful craft beers.  Be sure to check out their website for taproom only beers and new releases!

reviews.author: Karleigh D.
reviews.description: First time at this brewery and I can't recommend it enough! Service was great and the food truck outside had the most amazing pizza! Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Theresa W.
reviews.description: I love coming to twisted x - many variety of brews and occasionally new ones! I've had the lagers and ales!  Say hi to Alex and tell them Theresa Math sent you!  You won't get a deal, but it'll make him feel special!

reviews.author: Katie L.
reviews.description: Beer was good. Very laid back place. One of the smaller breweries but still a must try when in the area.

reviews.author: Jeremy L.
reviews.description: Fun brewery.  Very friendly and informative people to answer my questions of the beer and location.   Beautiful space, inside and out. Not on main road so not as crowded as some places nearby.   Happy to stop and visit.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Delightful beer, lovely setting. Live music on a Saturday afternoon. Good food truck. Excellent overall experience.  And we love that they support Divine Canines through Barks for Beers!

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: I had been meaning to check this place out for a while.  I have been a big fan of their Chupahopra for quite some time and finally made the pilgrimage.    The brewery has nice curbside appeal.  The structure is nicely done and their is a little area for the doggies.  Of note, dogs are also allowed in the tasting room.   There is also a food truck there.  The inside is your typical tasting room with an industrial look.  It is nicely done.  The bartenders are good.    The prices are right.  I would recommend the flight so you can try ones.  I really think they do a good job on the IPAs.  Their beers are quite good.   But of all of them, i favor the Chupahopra!

reviews.author: Stefanie D.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time this past Saturday. There as a good crowd, busy but not packed, and we had no problem grabbing two seats.   It's not a huge place, but they have tables and chairs outside, an outdoor patio section and then some indoor. You can also sit at the bar. They had live music while we were there (a single guy and a guitar which was pleasant and not overwhelming, and there is a food truck on site. Plenty of parking as well.   We told the girl behind the bar it was our first time, and she did a great job of talking about the beers. I'm not an IPA fan so she recommended the German lager, which I found to be delicious. My friend got the mango IPA which he also liked a lot. And a good price at $5 per glass.   They have tours twice a day but we missed it as well as merch for sale. All in all, I found it to be a great place to hang out on a Saturday afternoon and it's in close proximity to Salt Lick and other wineries/breweries. Definitely make it part of the list to stop at!

name: AquaBrew
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: My husband I drove to SM from Austin for a school event. Weather and traffic were crazy and we missed the event. We were both disappointed and decided to find a place to eat to salvage the night. That's where AquaBrew came in. The environment of AB is warm and comfortable. The service is nice, attentive, and happy. And the food and beer...  My husband got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork sandwich- the spicy slaw was delish. Both were really tasty and hot, fries were crispy and salty. The IPAs were delicious with the food.  Definitely looking forward to the next chance I have to go back.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: We visited AquaBrew after eating at Industry next door. This brewery has many great beers on their list. I enjoyed the San Marcos Blonde.  There is plenty of indoor seating, a great patio and of course the bar area.  It was easy to social distance from other people and very clean. We will return. The staff was very nice and helpful. If you are looking for a good local brewery to support, AquaBrew is the place.

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: Their new location wasn't updated on any maps so we ended up waking all around it until we called to find out what else we could use on maps to locate them. When we walked in we were very disappointed in their craft selection. I had researched this prior to choosing to go there based on their craft choices showed online. Again, something else that needed to be updated. Also, they aren't serving food. There was a large dog walking around that would come right up to you or sneak up under the tables and lick your feet. I like dogs so it was ok but for someone that doesn't..... Would not go back here until they get fully moved or opened.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: After going to the outlet mall we got a little thirsty we had already ordered some other food but we're unable to eat it within the restaurant so we called and asked awkward crew if we could order some of the beer and use your patio to eat our food they were very accommodating very nice people we even got to try to of their beers which tasted great

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: They've thought about everything at this brewery.  Great food, live music, seating inside, outside, and UPSTAIRS on the deck!  When the weather is right, they have the big glass garage doors open.  Yeah, they brew their own beer here and they have a decent selection.  It's not your typical brewery where you can just stroll in and choose the table you want to sit at.  That's because they have full table service for food and drinks.  I prefer breweries that let you wander around from the bar, to an outside table, to an inside table, and then back again - you know, rinse, lather, and repeat (relaxed and unstructured - I need that once in a while).  If you just want to stop in for a quick beer, you can sit at the bar.  The bar is quite large but also very popular with the college crowd, so it's hard to get a seat at times.   Now to the serious stuff - the beer!  I've had their Kolsch (San Marcos Blonde) and their Vienna Lager.  The blonde was the run of the mill Kolsch, not bad by any means, but the Vienna Lager - wow!  It had a great malty taste to it.  I liked it so much that I purchased a crowler of it to take home.  I rarely do that, so that tells you it must be good.  Enough useless banter - here's everything else you need to know about this place:  Free parking lot right next door or free 2 hr street parking.   Patio areas in the front and the back with overhead infrared heaters and fans with misters (they have both Texas seasons covered).  This place is popular with the college kids - TOO popular.  Growler refills are $12 or $18 for 64 oz, and $24 or $36 for 128 oz, depending on the beer you select.    Crowlers to go:  $8 or $10 (depending on the beer).  You can get three for $20 or $25 (depending on the beer).  Plenty of food options.   And I almost forgot to tell you - they have a FULL bar, not just beer!

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Aquabrew is definitely a gem in San Marcos. I learned about it through the purchase of the brewery tour on Groupon. The tour was quaint because it's not that big, but very interesting.  The gentleman who gave the tour seemed a bit rushed at the end, but he answered our questions and seemed very knowledgeable.   At the end of the tour we got to sample some beer. They also have a beer club where you buy a growler, we got the one for $100, and join their beer club. You get a punch card for 10 refills on the growler. My husband and I got one each for $200. I was thinking it an "okay" deal i guess. Truthfully I wasn't that thrilled cause of the price. But OMG!!!! IT IS WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY FOLKS!!!!.   Aquabrew has some of the best beers around. I am Army and have lived and traveled all over the world and this lil place holds its ground when it comes to beers! Purchasing the growler is the best deal too.   I have not had the food yet, but the place is always busy and people seem to love it. And they have some of the cutest guys behind the bar.  In all, I give this gem an A+

reviews.author: Maggie M.
reviews.description: Used to be my favorite restaurant in San mo but returned recently and they have the weirdest vibe now. None of their food is offered (you get two options from a backyard stand) standoffish servers and a gloomy vibe. Sooooo disappointed and hope to see this place make it back to its prime.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: The first thing about AquaBrew that I enjoyed was the vibe. This place really has a community feel with longer style tables and an incredible open patio with fans and lighting, ping pong and live music... and of course... beer.  The food was very flavorful. Thai chicken had good spice and the chicken thigh was tender and juicy. The Margarita flatbread was fresh tasting. The arugula salad was huge and bursting with fruits and flavor.  The beer was excellent and just what you'd expect from an onsite brewery.   Overall, if you're looking for a fun place for you and your peeps to chill, eat and drink in San Marcos... you'd do well to try this place. Plus it's right up the street from the Cheetham St warehouse.

reviews.author: Kris N.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I had an amazing experience at aquabrew. We got to talk a lot with the brewer CJ and he's extremely smart and knows what he's doing. We tried at least 6 of the different drafts and were impressed by them all. I definitely recommend this place if your wanting to experience a new brewery to checkout!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the food was not. Should have known better than to order the steak at a bar like restaurant but it was basically inedible. Not even my 11 year old daughter would eat it. Supposed to be medium and came through well done. The waitress asked and I told her it was cooked bad and we couldn't eat it and she said "yeah I saw that" and proceeded to do absolutely nothing to fix it or make it right.   I'll go there for the beer but never again for the food

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: The beer was good, but not many choices on the menu. The restaurant is clean and has a good vibe. The food.... well it looked good. The taste... somewhat bland. My son likes it but he lost his tastebuds in an accident as a child.   I would come back for the beer and appetizers, but would pass on the dinner.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: Service - 5/5 great customer service ! Our waiter was very attentive and met all our needs.  Atmosphere - 4/5 pretty nice place . Long tables instead of individual tables to encourage people to meet new people ! Which is a really awesome concept . Also there's a large bar since it's also a brewery.  Food- my food was about a 3.5/5 , but my friends was a solid 1. Her salmon Benedict had almost uncuttable biscuit since it was so hard , and the most burnt potatoes I've ever seen. My food which was the stuffed French toast was pretty yummy, but not a lot to it.  Noise level - 1/5 THE BAND WAS SOOO LOUD. I couldn't here my friend talking 1 foot in front of me :(  Price - 2/5 wayyyy overpriced for what you get. My French toast was 11.91 and my friends meal was 15.91  Probably won't return unless it's for a group outing , but still a cool little place to check out !

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Odd to see the plethora of reviews stating that the service here in subpar, as this was definitely not the case when I went yesterday. Easy to get a seat and our waitress was very attentive, despite it being happy hour and slightly busy on a Friday after work.  As a table, we ordered the: a) Brew House Pretzel - Amazingly soft and the beer queso is a great pairing  b) AB Bacon Jam Fries - HOLY! The bacon jam itself is something I've never had before and I must say this makes it a must return for me  c) Glass of Imperial Pilsner - Smooth and pretty standard for a Pilsner  d) Glass of Artificial Intelligence Tripel (9.72% ABV) - Yeah...the ABV tells the story itself  This spot has a great atmosphere, very rustic and cozy. Definitely a nice place, just wish you could order directly from the bar for faster access to beer.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great location and cool venue. It's evident a lot of time and thought were put into this place.   Great beers, especially liked the Ape-ricot Wheat.   I wish I saved room for the Porter Ice Cream Float.   The AB burger was solid, maybe a little messy tho.  Forget the fries tho. The regular fires were under seasoned and chewy. Think Wendy's fries when you  don't finish them at lunch and try to eat them at the end of your shift. Bleh  The staff was super friendly.   The outdoor portion looks great but a bit too hot out today to go and enjoy it.

reviews.author: Tom C.
reviews.description: You know when someone takes a picture of themselves and posts it on Instagram,and it's at just the right angle to make them look super attractive? The Yelp reviews of this place kind of remind me of that. It's not that it was bad, but I was expecting a lot more.  The highlight of my meal was the Mosaic IPA. Balanced and drinkable, this beer was really enjoyable. I also tried the Swine Dive IPA. The taste of this was a little too clean for an IPA and just didn't have the hoppy depth to add to its character. Not bad, but I wouldn't get it again.  Overall the food I ordered was really lackluster. I didn't hate it, but it certainly wasn't a memorable meal. My chicken empanadas were oily, and had very little chicken in the filling. The whole thing struck me as more of acorn dog egg roll hybrid, and didn't really seem like an empanada at all. I was grateful for the spicy sauce it was served with, which was pretty tasty. I also ordered the brussel sprouts. There were some decent flavors here, but I would have really preferred them to have a little more char on them. They came across as slightly undercooked and worse yet, very wet. A little crispness would have gone a long way.  Service was fair, friendly enough but really on the slow side. It took me almost a half an hour to get my food and it wasn't crowded. The couple at the bar sitting next to me ordered hamburgers. I have to admit I was a little jealous because they looked good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Maybe it was a bad night. Whatever the reason I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Unfortunately the new menu and chef drops the rating from 5 to 4. Still friendly waitstaff and excellent happy hour. But the reason I come to AquaBrew and recommend it to everyone I meet is the food. The "new" salmon dish isn't even close to the goodness of the previous balsamic salmon with veggies. Dry. Lacked flavor. Sticky rice instead of the delish potatoes and only green beans instead of a mix of seasonal veggies. Hubby had the tostadas and 'meh' reaction. Will give it one more try before relegating it to happy hour only place with 3 stars. So sad.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What an awkward night...Our server did not check on us. We had to continue to ask for things...multiple times, from multiple people. That portion of the night really sucked.  Howeverrrr, the street corn, queso, crispy tuna, edamame, and loaded fried were reallyyyy good. We especially loved the street corn. I wish we would've gotten the delicious food on time, instead of having to remind the staff multiple times butttt at least it tasted amazing??   I can't give them more stars even though the food was great because service is so so so important.

reviews.author: Emari S.
reviews.description: Omg I tried their Shrimp and Grits and they were delicious  and I Also tried their bacon jam fries and they were impeccable. I really enjoyed the margarita I had and the atmosphere was nice. Are usually never think of AquaBrew to eat at, but now that I finally tried it, I will definitely go back! Love it! The shrimp and grits is super buttery but I LOVE IT

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Just left after lunch. Cute/hip spot with friendly staff.   We ordered the AB burger and I did an upgrade to their bacon jam fries ($4 upgrade). I was so excited to try these fries but they were very underwhelming to me. $4 is steep for an up charge but had I enjoyed them I wouldn't have minded. The burger was the best bite on the table. It was small in size but very juicy and tasty. Not one to split.   Next up was the fried chicken and eggs. It has so many things I typically like - fried chicken, cream gravy, bacon jam, eggs, but I didn't like this dish. It lacked dimension of flavor. It needed something. The herbed fries that came with it were good. I liked them better than the $4 bacon jam ones.   Our kids split the stuffed French toast. The only ate a little bit because it was too sweet. If a kid thinks something is too sweet you know it's toooooo sweet. Neither ate it. It was a waste of money.   Overall I'm glad we tried it but don't need to return on our own accord.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: I was very excited to come to this brewery today!  The waitress we had was very friendly, but what bothered me was the male kitchen staff. We saw a guy walk from the kitchen with a bottle of what looked like vodka and went outside to their outside area and was playing around.   The food was DELICIOUS!! My husband got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork sandwich. He for regular fries for his side and i got a sweet potato.
