We weren't a fan of the regular fries, so I highly recommend the sweet potato.   We also ordered the mimosa flight and were kinda impressed. For $20 you get a whole bottle of champagne and 4 different flavor options. We chose chipotle pineapple, watermelon, passion fruit and lavender. All amazing.   This place is spacious. The food is amazing. I was just unimpressed with a few waitstaff/bar staff members. We went next door to Chances afterwards and they mentioned the management has gone down hill.   I hadn't mentioned we aren't from the area. We are from Austin. This place had stellar food and for a night shift it wasn't awful. Give them a shot!!

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Madison ... Madison... Madison! She was absolutely wonderful today. Welcoming.. knowledgeable and provided an amazing customer experience today. Can't wait to see you guys soon!   - Holmes

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: Industry leading!  Well I was finally able to get to San Marcos and got to walk around the square. In doing so I found several bars and coffee shops which was great! The bars were still pretty empty being that it was only 3pm and I needed human interaction! That was when I found Industry. It's no secret that Industry is great, based on their reviews and I was happy to have found it to be so close. For me, there were 3 things that really separated Industry. The first being my bartender, Madison. She did an outstanding job making sure I felt welcomed and was quick to present water in which I especially appreciated given the heat. She knew the beer menu and gave me a few recommendations, eventually nailing it with a beer called Easy Rider. I recommend it if you're into a craft blonde ale. I also ordered a dirty martini  and ask her if she would make it the way she usually does, which turned out great. She used Botanist Gin which was perfecto with just the right amount of floral. Thanks Madison for the solid recommendations and the hospitality. Very much obliged. I ordered the Brussel sprouts, of course, which were cooked perfectly and had a wonderful (light) mustard finish. My only complaint was the size of the sprouts, not to be confused with the portion size, which was more than enough for one person. I just figured it had something to do with the season and happily ate up. I was 3 for 3 and couldn't have left happier.  Industry is a really cool, upbeat spot and I will most definitely be back when I get the chance. They are dog friendly, too, with water bowls and treats in the patio area.   Highly recommend!!  Sincerely,  MLA

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: TLDR a-ok to I'm a fan despite some bumps  My first time ordering for pickup. Everything was delicious, it was ready at the time promised. The big flaw was I didn't get the beer battered squash I ordered and paid for, but as Mr R didn't check the bag before leaving we cannot lay that all on them. It was a very busy night and mistakes happen.  The other error was I didn't get the 30% off to-go booze still advertised on their online menu which is why this isn't 5*  Mr R is besotted with their black bean veggie burger. I think there must be spice in the patty as none of the other listed ingredients explain its lovely low heat. He also likes the texture of the bean patty, he wanted me to mention that.  The salmon burger was good, huge, nice fresh veg, I love the spice in the aioli and poblano ranch, but I REALLY wish they still did the smoked salmon bagel I had one brunch there long ago.  The farm beet salad? Gorgeous. Mr R gleefully ate most of it on his own and he often eats salads with a sense of duty rather than joy. I loved the white balsamic vinaigrette it came with, I'm going to need that more often in my life.  The drinks to go? Hooray! One note, bring your own standard brown pulp drink tray if you think you'll need one because they didn't provide one. The pours were fabulous on our mimosas, The Closer and White Box. Ice was the perfect amount.  The transaction could have gone smoother, but the meal went down great. This remains a place Mr R wants to go *every* time he's in town.

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place sucks! It's not satisfying nor flavorful. The chili is like soup no meat or anything in it! Yea it may look good but it's not.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: The Moscow mule was amazing!! So I'm new to exploring San Marcos and I looked up most reviewed or topped reviewed. I am not disappointed. This place is great!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Upon entering, I was immediately awestruck by the warm and inviting aesthetic. After this feast of the eyes, my ears were next to hop on the joyride as I was serenaded with a playlist that felt as if it were compiled to induce the ultimate feeling of joyous nostalgia. Then I sat down, had an outstandingly healthy and delicious everything bowl that went extremely well with the excellent recommendation of Pilsner made by the kind and knowledgeable staff. The owner clearly takes pride in the experience and it shows. 5 stars might not be sufficient, I wish I had the ability to allot additional stars. Bravo

reviews.author: Lanette T.
reviews.description: It's for sure a god size. The flavor was alright. The workers were nice when I was there.

reviews.author: Kuracha B.
reviews.description: My first time and the pancakes really really bad!!! everythings burnt! its not even edible. i asked the server and she made me look like im the one at fault tir not letting her know. seriously!!!

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: We came down from Dallas and made industry our 1st-night-in-town place for drinks and dinner. We had an awesome time with Thor as our bartender last time we were in town. He was there this time and we got to say hi again. We sat at the bar and Raina took great care of us! We tried 2 lagers from different TX breweries and had some great shots. I could not decide among 3 choices for dinner, so I let her pick and surprise me. She chose the al pastor tacos. They were delicious! We are only staying in San Marcos 4 days and are already planning to go back for dinner on Monday! Ps if you are a whiskey drinker, try this! It was so smooth!

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: This must be a very popular place. Came in for Sunday brunch and it was packed! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The $11  mimosa carafe special immediately got my attention. I knew I had to have that. Found us a booth on the left corner by the bar. Ordered the mimosa, 2 industry burgers, Parmesan fries and the tater tot casserole. The mimosa was disappointingly room temperature. The burgers were bordering on salty but were good. We especially liked the chips and salsa that came with it. The fries were good but a little expensive for what you get. The tater tot casserole , we didn't like at all. Very salty and the hot sauce did not go with the dish at all. Don't think we'll come back.

reviews.author: Fletcher R.
reviews.description: One of the worst restaurant experiences in a while. Saturday lunch where we literally waited over an hour from ordering food to food on our table and the food I got not only had a sticker on the fries, but the BBQ sandwich was dry and inedible. I've now been here twice and never been happy with the food. I won't be back.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: There were mixed reviews...the adults loved their food! We had the CFC w queso - gave it two thumbs up!! We also had the chicken tacos and the person who had those raves about how good they were! We also had the queso, salsa, fried squash, loaded fries and Brussel sprouts for appetizer and all were a huge hit!! Most of the teenagers had the burgers and did not like them. They said they tasted like sausage. I think the issue is the burgers were very, very lean and smoked so they were a little dry.  The BIGGEST COMPLAINT were the flies...OMG!!! So freaking annoying to have to constantly be waving your hand back and forth so a darn fly does not land on your food!! Do something about that bc we would never come back solely for that purpose!

reviews.author: Bri W.
reviews.description: We have gone to Industry probably about 5 times now and we are never disappointed. I love the unique but healthy food options which sometimes seems hard to find. Prices are totally reasonable and we will keep coming back!

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I can't believe i haven't reviewed this place yet. its one of my favorite splurge restaurant as a broke  21yr old in san marcos! Brunch is amazing, honestly i feel that no matter what you get you cant go wrong. I LOVE their Parmesan fries and their CFC with queso. Those boozy milkshakes are small but yes, boozy such as the rest of their alcoholic beverages. The industry burger and brisket tacos are also so amazing.

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: A farm to table concept convenient for those living in the area..ingredients are sourced locally. which is great for supporting our small  farmers. Masks are being worn by staff and limited capacity allows for social distancing.  There is patio dining however being right off the street with cars passing by frequently Tonight's food was good..Delicious smoked chicken thigh then fried much like a chicken fried chicken..Boy that smoke came through so well. Not a gargantuan serving like a chicken breast but nonetheless yummy.  The Reuben was great-toasty and melty...love Kraut so I would've doubled up. Cool college vibes and can see how this place might pack it in easily on any night of the week

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: This place was very trendy! I actually liked it it has the college vibe too it, of course Texas State is very close, the food was great and San Marcos grew on me after this visit looking forward to coming back.

reviews.author: Nancy B.
reviews.description: My first time here and I love it! The food was delicious and reasonably priced. My boyfriend and I definitely had left overs. My favorite was definitely the sweet benny and chili cheese fries. I'm not usually a chili cheese fry fan but this chili is legitimately so delicious with chunks of brisket in it! The biscuit and jam combo is delcious but it was definitely more suited for 3 to 4 people instead of 2 with other dishes ordered. In hindsight, ordering 2 types of fried potatoes was probably over kill but still delicious none the less. I didn't try the half off mimosas but for sure next time, I'll definitely be getting a cocktail to try!   The staff was super friendly and great at getting our food out in a timely manner. The vibe out there was perfect and a lot of fun with the live music!  They seemed very on top of the cleaning and everyone wore masks when standing.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Industry is such a cute spot! You can really taste the freshness in the food. It's particularly a great spot right now because of its expansive outdoor seating.  This is a place that has something for everyone! The sweet potato fries are my fave.   Bathrooms are clean, staff were friendly, and they followed Covid guidelines for spacing. Will deff be coming back here!

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: This place is a can't miss, particularly when it comes to the really excellent food.  We ordered the okra, some sweet potato fries and smoked chicken tacos.  In spite of the fact that the kitchen was unexpectedly slammed today, the food was incredible.  I cannot overstate how good everything was and the value was terrific.  Also, since we sat at the bar, we watched Tiffany in full "go-time" mode.  She was professional and personable; making it look easy to provide drinks for a whole bar/restaurant single-handedly.  Although the process was apparently moving slower than normal, the interactions with her made it much more tolerable and it was a lot of fun talking to her.  We will definitely return.

reviews.author: Giselle P.
reviews.description: Amazing food and atmosphere. The live music and ping pong tables added to the experience.

reviews.author: Ju L.
reviews.description: Long overdue review, but I appreciated the gentleman who wrapped my last minute Christmas gift. I just asked for a paper bag but he went the extra miles to make it all nice with wrapping paper and bow. Thanks :) will be back

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: Nope, will not return here.  Barely a mumble from store employee after entering their store that was empty of patrons.  I remember coming here at their Grand Opening and they were a lot more enthusiastic about their customers. Hopefully, they will find better help soon.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Will not be returning here. Selection is ok not great, service is ok, however , these days most do not carry cash and to be up charged for using a debit card to pay for the CC service is a joke, and pay attention to the amount  almost 4% of the total, I am thinking another way to profit a little at a time. Just bad business not whiskey business

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I waked into this store not expecting much.  Boy, was I wrong.  He has a really good selection of bourbon.  I walked out with a bottle that I've never seen on any other shelf, anywhere else.  It wasn't much more expensive than the larger stores, and he actually had it.  I didn't even check out the scotch selection, which I  need to go back and do.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: They have a good selection but they are kinda pricey. Perfect if you just need a bottle but not if you're looking to restock several items.

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: Came in to make it quick liquor store run, left with two welcoming friends and a much greater appreciation of all the options at my fingertips. Waylon and Weston where more than available to answer questions and make recommendations and overall create a hospitable and enjoyable shopping experience. I look forward to going back and taking some friends with me because I know we won't be disappointed in the party they help supply!

reviews.author: Geary H.
reviews.description: One of the first things when I entered their store, their dog "Whiskey" greeted me, then the owners. Handshakes when you show up; that's Texas! Whiskey Business has a diverse, quality, well-priced inventory. They had everything I needed. Even took home a six of Boerne Brewery's Old Courthouse Ale at the owner's suggestion. It's like he knew what I'd like. He did. One of my favorites is an Irish dry stout {think Guinness}, and I've now found a new favorite. Love it! I'll make Whiskey Business my go-to. Thank you for your hospitality!

reviews.author: Kodi S.
reviews.description: A new liquor store in town! Great selection, I put in a few requests and they had them in by the next visit. The staff is awesome, very friendly folks. I wont lie, I'm a regular now mostly because of their dog- Whiskey. ‍

reviews.author: Nechelle D.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable and courteous service. Definitely where I'll always go and send everyone!

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: Come ON! How much fun is your own private, traveling bar? Serving only the finest of beverages, you'll have a quality time with these quality brews.

reviews.author: Rita M.
reviews.description: When you hear the word BUS one would normally think about a city bus or there like. This is not the case for the Crafty Thirst Beer Bus, no it's a VW van that is being used to serve beer. We were passing by and noticed a sign that said Grand Opening. We stopped to check out this Grand Opening. We were approached by this creepy guy smoking a cigarette as he said do you have ID, we showed our drivers licenses and instead of saying thank you, have a nice day anything he just stared at us. We were reading the list of beers that were offered. It was a little confusing as there was no direction on what the beers were are how much they were. We decided to order at the VW "BUS". We were asking what different types of beers were available and how much they were. The guy that was helping us (later found out was the one of the owners) passed us to someone else. We thought that was rude but the lady that served us made up for it. The beers were $7.00 dollars for a 9 ounce or you could get 4 -  7 ounces for $10.00 dollars to me that is extremely high. Most of the places in Canyon Lake have beers for $2.50. The beer we had, had more of a foam head on it and we were not offered to top it off. Another guy was serving mixed drinks one with Pecan Rum. The mixed drinks were $7.00 dollars, high for the area and the amount you get. I will confess that the rum was one of the best I have had. A few times I heard other people saying that the price's were too high. If you can get a beer for $2.50 then why would someone pay $7.00 dollars. The band was the only entertainment and they were amazing. There was suppose to be a raffle for the VW BUS but when I asked about it I was told that it was not going to take place. This was troubling being that I was told by the owner that it was the main giveaway.

name: Zelicks
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I really love their burgers and those cheese fries are to die for. Ive also tried their pulled pork quesadilla, steak @ their steak night ( $16 every Tuesday!) and those are solid choices as well. I liked the chicken sandwich but it didn't wow me like the other items i've listed above. Bartenders and staff are super friendly. Overall a great atmosphere, especially now that it's getting chillier out!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: A must stop in San Marcos. Really great chill vibes, good drinks, and good company. Haven't gone at night but apparently super fun!!

reviews.author: Kimber B.
reviews.description: I love this place. Consistent good drinks, good food, good music and outstanding atmosphere.   Intimate Live music scene, chill vine with yard games check it out.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Hands down the best neighborhood bar in San Marcos! Tuesday night steak night is amazing. The flavor, texture and price is absolutely amazing. Best steak in town with the best signature drinks around. A great mixed crowd of really cool people, not just college kids, but true locals from all walks. Owned and run by two amazing brothers - They are deeply rooted into this community and really give back in soooo many ways. I love this place, centrally located with great drinks and fun clientele!

reviews.author: Natasha B.
reviews.description: Perfect dog friendly patio, lots of out door seating, drinks where good. Staff was nice

reviews.author: Griffin S.
reviews.description: Amazing spot. Great staff! Good social media presence as well... @zelicks on Instagram.

reviews.author: Cheech A. C.
reviews.description: This place was sick, drove by it multiple times and was a huge fan of the aesthetic. Great visuals and vibes for a nice day. The staff was however, sus. They seemed to have attitudes of a bar that is not in a college town but a boujee downtown bar. The bartender who was close to my age charged me for regular priced drinks when we ordered 2/3 of our drinks in the happy hour range. When I came to close out and order our (3rd) last drink. The bartender said "do you mind if I close you out?" I thought this was very odd as it was a Wednesday evening and I was purchasing not only alcohol but food. I do believe they have an amazing food truck that supplies great food. I am sure this was a one time fluke as the rest of the experience was great. I do stand by my opinion that the staff maybe biased to certain crowds so be weary.

reviews.author: Patty T.
reviews.description: If I lived in San Marcos, THIS would be my local go-to spot. Great service, I felt very safe with their COVID rules and regulations. Loved the atmosphere and customer service and ice cold beers. My bestie and I had a mini day in San Marcos as a girls trip within in COVID rules and we loved this little spot. We found it while looking at houses in the neighborhood surrounding the bar. The staff was kind and courteous and the misters and fans were a nice cooling off touch with the Texas heat.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: Love this place!  The Blueberry Sangria is THE BOMB!  Steak night is FABULOUS!  Bartenders are awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic!  I love how diverse the clientele is, and it's just a cool place to be!

reviews.author: Jan B.
reviews.description: I love the queso and fries. I'm addicted. And my bevs are always great. Service is always timely and it has such a relaxing vibe. I always look forward to coming here....

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great local San Marcos bar that has great service and some really good drinks. It is a fun place to hang out after floating the river! I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Adison H.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to hang out and have some drinks. Breezy open feel with plenty of covered seating as well in case of rain. Service is fast and bartenders are very attentive.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout bar for casual day drinking and hanging with friends ! Always something going on from live music , art displays , to crawfish boils! They have happy hour everyday from 2-7 ( and all day on Sunday) which include a big 4$ strawberry margarita that I could dieeee for! If you are under 21 you can't stay past 7 which has always been a little upsetting considering some of my friends are underage and they are very strict about it , but still one of my favorite bars on the square .

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Best Bloody Mary around! Cool atmosphere and love how they have their own herb garden out back. Great place to hang with friends, watch sports, and have a good drink in or outside.

reviews.author: Nathan T.
reviews.description: An extremely laid back bar experience. Great place to either start or end a bar crawl. A little crowded at times but that's every bar on the square. Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: Hands down my favorite place to get a drink in San Marcos. Great service better drinks, and atmosphere

reviews.author: Terese O.
reviews.description: Awesome bar that really has something for everyone no matter what your age is. They have a great large indoor and outdoor space making it a perfect spot to hang with friends. They even have a food truck that serves tasty bar eats. I love the michelads and bloodies. They offer many beer variations and tasty cocktails. Also, a bonus they offer HH/drink specials!

reviews.author: Alto G.
reviews.description: Coolest bar in town. I wish it were less crowded, but you can't be a hater when they do so much right!

reviews.author: Cheyanne H.
reviews.description: Great service, the only bar near downtown that's not riddled with frat guys and sorority girls. Dog friendly, but keep them on the leash! Friendly staff, good environment, easily my favorite bar in the area. Also, the neon sign in the women's bathroom is great, I hear the men's bathroom neon sign is pretty funny too. You must visit this place!

reviews.author: Tay R.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is absolutely awesome. Love an outside bar that can accommodate in weather as well (they bring heaters out / close garage doors etc). I always have a great time here. There's a variety of games throughout the place (corn hole, washers, big jenga) and there's a variety of spread out seating locations / areas. They frequently have a variety of seasonal things on draft as well as a good variety of beers in general. Definitely recommend going to check this place out if in the area and looking for a chill vibe.

name: The Growling
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a really cool place to stop by and get a pint of a regional beer or refill your growler with your favorite brew to take home (growlers only, no crowlers here).  Friendly, and more importantly, knowledgeable tap masters that can match your beer tastes to the selections on tap.   You can order a pitcher of beer at this place!  I don't see this in many growler stations.  All in all, it's a very fun place.  The staff and the customers are very chill and down to earth.  It's in a strip center at the corner of LBJ and East Sessom Dr.  The address is listed on LBJ and while you can enter there, it's a lot easier if you enter from East Sesson Drive.  And there's a LOT more parking on this side.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great little dive bar in San Marcos with lots of local beers on tap. The bartender was very nice and knowledgeable and it was not very crowded at all. I love the music they play there as well. It is very low-key so if you feel like just sitting down and having a couple beers in talking with the regulars it is perfect perfect

reviews.author: Karma R.
reviews.description: We were just gonna share 1 beer and go but Ted was so cool that we sat here and talked with him and kept drinking until their first karaoke night  back since last year !!! Yassss!!! Good times good vibes good beer good peeps and good space !!!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: The decor of this place is very unique. You pretty much just have to see it for yourself. The walls are loaded with artwork for sale from local artists. Very interesting pieces. But enough about that.  This place is loaded with craft beer from Texas. Texas is apparently pretty big in that regard (and nearly every other regard). For a place as small and intimate as it is, there's a lot of seating packed in it and even some outdoor seating. There's games, lots of games. Card games, board games, darts, pool, and sometimes even a live DJ.  If you dig the craft brew scene this place is surely right up your alley. If you find yourself in San Marcos come check em out!

reviews.author: Laura K.
reviews.description: Part of what makes The Growling so delightful, is the atmosphere. I'm new to the craft beer scene -- and this was a perfect welcome.  The staff is friendly and can also help me decide what to order if I'm unsure. I've had fun trying to new beers and discovering what have become my go-to selections. (Bonus : All the beer they serve is from Texas!) Between the mix of good people and good beer - this has become my favorite bar.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: Went to this local brew house last night and I was absolutely blown away. They have all Texas craft beers, 28 on tap, fresh, and they even have a few selections in cans and some wine!      I was shocked when I saw they had The Infinite Monkey Theorem Rose' ....impressive.   The vibe is awesome. Super laid back, chill, artsy, and hipster. Loves it.       The owners are lovely people. So nice, great service, and very informative on every single beer. They make it their priority to get the perfect beer for you.   They have some savory oyster crackers for you to enjoy while you booze it up. Cards Against Humanity is also available to play for free!        The decor was my favorite. I was super into the refurbished wooden pallets, the art work, the baby succulents, and the colors!   Will definitely be returning many more evenings.

reviews.author: Michelle O.
reviews.description: I love this bar! There are dogs! I repeat, this is a dog bar! I wish we had dog bars in San Antonio. I had no idea San Marcos was so cool. This is the first bar I visited in SMTX and I was very impressed. Very cool vibe, lots of dogs to pet and neat art on the walls. I like that they have board games and such. I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Dustin W.
reviews.description: This place has the best tap selection in San Marcos, hands down. No place in town even comes close to getting the quality beers that this bar does. The owner is always a great help for beer selection and a super cool dude. Try a craft beer or get your growler filled. I highly recommend The Growling!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a variety of beers in a laid back spot- this is the place. We tried a variety of beers from a variety of places and the bar staff was very knowledgeable in guiding our visit. Definitely enjoyed, and will be back!

reviews.author: Brandee A.
reviews.description: In San Marcos for the weekend and checked this place out for a few beers based on the great Yelp rating. Yelpers are definately right on the mark here. Great selection of Texas beers. Very helpful staff who encouraged us to sample several based on our likes including several blends we may not have thought of trying. 2 beers led to 3 and then 4. Sad to leave but had a game to catch. Until next time, keep up the great cheer and beer!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: This place is super duper dope! Great selection, continuously changing taps all from Texas. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, free street fighter, and chill vibes. Great place to hang out and drink delicious Texas beer.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As far as growler places in San Marcos, The Growling is as good as it gets!  With that being said, I've been to growler places in the greater Austin area and IMHO, I think The Growling is better than most of them.  As previously mentioned, there are 28 beers on tap, all Texas-made stuff, but unlike other growler places I've been to they have a bar and you can drink a pint, invite friends, and just hang out. The owners are super friendly and work hard to set you up with the perfect craft beer experience! They even have a stage setup for live music and get live acts mostly on the weekend.  Also, as previously mentioned, there is no kitchen but they allow outside food and with Pie Society, Bobcat nation, Dos Gatos, Mocas/Javas, Rose Garden (Chinese), and Thai Thai in close proximity; you won't have to go far to fight off those hunger cravings! They haven't been open very long (less than 2 months) so they're off to a slow start but hopefully as word gets out they'll start getting busier and maybe even expand on what's an already great start! If you're in San Marcos for the River, the Square, the Hill Country, or in school looking to skip class, The Growling is every bit worth checking out!

reviews.author: Toni V.
reviews.description: Nothing like a craft brew to quench your thirst any day of the week! What a great spot - the staff is very welcoming and friendly and are very knowledgeable about the different brews on tap to help you find the right one to fit those taste buds. The beer flight the bartenders picked/poured for me were great and I look forward to coming back and tasting the other brews on tap. Looks like I found a great alternative to overcrowded beergardens in Austin so cheers to more trips I'll be making to San Marcos!

reviews.author: Lianne S.
reviews.description: The Growling always has good vibes, smooth tunes, and awesome art/entertainment selection tasty brews and great company with Manny and the undrownable countess !

reviews.author: Tabitha G.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out at the end of a long day! There are games to play on the tables, cool music, and good films running on the tv. Sometimes they have live music which is always great! Come by and check them out!

reviews.author: Lucy H.
reviews.description: So glad to discover this place! Excellent selection and awesome atmosphere, bar guy, and fellow customers.

reviews.author: Amrendra K.
reviews.description: The place is amazing, you can walk in with your dog and order food from outside. Barman is amazing, actually they take turns, the one I like is the one who lets a scorpion and is super crazy. He will always recommend the right craft beer for you. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Pasha C.
reviews.description: Great selection! Very relaxed and mellow atmosphere. They always have tons of beer on tap and they are all Texas beers. Plus the staff is very helpful at suggesting beers.

reviews.author: Phoebe M.
reviews.description: Best selection of beers in sm!! They have electric jellyfish. they'll give you samples till you find what you want! Amazing service. A little pricey for a drink in a college town, but appropriate for the establishment I think.

reviews.author: Travis W.
reviews.description: Seriously awesome local beers.  The bartender is extremely knowledgeable. A true hidden gem for craft brews of Texas.

name: Taproom Pub and Grub
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Food was great, beer was cold.  Place is always noisy, but as it is a pub, I can get past that.    We were seated at the bar and were served by the bartender.  He did a great job, was wonderful to talk to, and made great menu suggestions.    Excellent appetizers...great burgers.    A great stop in SMTX.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I used to love this place as a young college kid but now that I am older it just didn't cut it for me.   The food is good but it's super sloppy and too much.  The service is okay.  They have a good drink selection.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I like to get The Works burger with some barbecue on the side! For fries i prefer the wedge cut fries. my partner tried the mac n cheese burger and chili cheese fries and they were huge! The don't skimp here, and the service is nice as well.

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Waited over an hour for food to come out and it was just ok. The brisket didn't really have any flavor.  I would not come back to eat at this place

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: We love the Taproom! The new owners are great. 5 stars all around! Great burgers, tons of draft selections.

reviews.author: Sanaz D.
reviews.description: Wonderful burgers! We were a group of 19 people, went in all hungry and got out super happy with the food. Amazing taste of burger and really good service in spite of the busy hour we went in on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings about this. I came with a party of seven so I expected the service to be a little delayed. That being said, we all got burgers so I feel like it could have been faster? The food hit the spot after a day on the river but just to get the waiters attention was hard work as they only had 4 people on duty. Then to pay the check again it was another long wait. I can't recommend this place if you're hungry, but if you have the time, sure you should go. Prices were reasonable.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. First time visit last month and we were pleased with overall service and food. The burgers are huge (in my opinion) and they have a nice selection of beers/cocktails. Staff were super pleasant and prompt - it's nice spot for a quick fix at reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this bar.  It is outdoors and there is ample seating.  I also love looking at the huge variety of plants that cover every inch of this place.  The drinks are good and the staff is friendly. Overall, a great place to unwind and socialize.

reviews.author: Jeremy B.
reviews.description: Salty with a side of Micro transactions.   I have had a few items here and I would have to say this is the saltiest food in San Marcos and not in a good way.  Their menu is very over priced and boy do they love their micro-transactions or add-ons.  Fries are extra with their expensive and average burgers. BACON is like $2 extra.  They charge you for using a credit card and so much more.   Their queso is Velveeta and rotel and not even that good. Most of their chips they serve with the queso is tiny broken scraps and they get annoyed if you ask for more.   The staff is either uncaring or over-worked. I have had many incidences where I am eating solo and am ignored in getting service initially and after.  This is most likely because the server is more interested in dealing with the beer drinking frat guys. Almost every time I have been there I have been left without a basic refill of water. Many times i have also sat waiting for my food with no sight of my server.   The only saving grace of this place is the half price wings on Wednesday, but even then I would get them to go.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Drove up to San Marcos from SA to meet sister and niece to help move into dorms.  They were running late, so decided to stop here for some drks and grab a quick bite.  Place was not that crowded (in the front) and the tables were spaced out.  View was nice to enjoy those strolling by  the sidewalk.  The sign at the front said $3.50 bloody mary's, so I ordered one and it was the bomb (see pic).  Perfect drink that had all the fixin's.  The Chicken and Waffle Bites caught my attention, so I ordered that to hold us over.  These were really good and worth the appetizer! The reason for 2 stars knocked off were the service that was absent throughout our time here.  He disappeared all the time and couldn't find him once my sister and niece showed up.  This service made me decide to go somewhere else for lunch.  The other star was due to being charged full-price for the 2 bloody mary's.  I didn't say anything, as I wasn't sure when the waiter would come back and also felt small businesses need any extra cash during these times.  I still tipped the waiter, since they need money too but not sure how he was so busy with a light audience in the place.

reviews.author: Pam B.
reviews.description: Most delicious burger I've ever eaten!!  The bun is homemade with a hint of sweetness (think Hawaiian Bread) and the patty is thick and cooked perfectly. The fries were also to die for, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and perfectly seasoned. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rebecca C.
reviews.description: They've got a good selection of beers and ciders (for the non-beer drinkers like myself). I come specifically for the pizza burgers. They are my go to burger when I get a burger craving. However, I have heard that all their other specialty burgers are amazing as well.   My one complaint is the service. It's mainly a bar, it's going to be busy- I get it. I've worked the industry. But every time I've gone, something is wrong with my order, I'm double charged on something, or the waitress hardly ever comes to check on us.   I'll keep coming for the amazing burgers- and they deserve the stars, but the service needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: Chad was an amazing bartender/server! He let us know his name and was very responsive when we needed him. I would not say we waited for anything really, the food was reasonably priced, and everything was delicious.

reviews.author: Dori S.
reviews.description: The server was nice but the food took 45 minutes to come out and was bland. My friend enjoyed his chicken club, but the Guacamole Queso Burger was baaaaad. Just a flavorless burger, buns, meh guac and velvetta queso.  The drinks were very good though. I'll probably only come back for the drinks.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: Look for my previous review y'all.  no resolution was ever made for that experience to ever be forgotten by me or them. They refused to serve me and I refused to stay quiet. I escalated to the owner after his employees all worked together to ensure that customer service is not important to them at all. I spend a lot of money eating out especially to try new things and I support local businesses. But I couldn't try their food because they don't accommodate properly to accept mastercard payment on a to go order (which they now claim they do allow). Hope you all decide to go somewhere else that values you as a customer. Support black owned businesses.  I hope the COVID hits them hard in the pockets.

reviews.author: Tina B.
reviews.description: First time here was a great experience. Tanya was a delight and remembered our names all night even though it was really busy. She is super personable and would make me want to come back again just to see her. Also, the burgers, beers, and fries were all on point.

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: What makes a great bar/restaurant? Great food, service, and cocktails. This place has all three and tons of character. Take a peek at all this history on the walls and someone will share of story of times past. Best burger in town and huge selection of beers on tap tops of the 5 star rating. It's a must visit if you are around San Marcos.

reviews.author: Jaye M.
reviews.description: Their burgers are amazing!!! I traveled from San Marcos to Kyle with the food and the burgers were still hot and amazing. The staff is really nice! While I was waiting a waitress asked if I wanted a water while I waited and I really appreciated it. I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Jada T.
reviews.description: This place is disgusting. When we first walked in it smelled like rotten eggs. There was a roach near our table, our food was gross/cold when it came out. The mac an cheese looks like oatmeal with way too much pepper.

reviews.author: Evelyn R.
reviews.description: Food is good and the atmosphere of the place even better. The tacos are huge, we didn't realized until we got the order that maybe 1-2 are more than enough.

reviews.author: Jeri T.
reviews.description: My mom and I were looking for a new place in San Marcos. We come here often from Kyle and tire of the places right on the interstate. The establishment is adorable - informal seating inside and out.   I first got some pappadum and a few chutneys-tamarind and mint. They were spicy! Caught me off guard but delicious for sure.    My mom ordered the Curry Trio with chicken curry, paneer tikka masala, and saag paneer. I ordered  a beef kabob curry taco. Every bite of every dish was delicious. While I loved my taco, I highly recommend the Curry Trio because you get a great choice.   When we first got there, I was like meh. Only a few tables were seated outside and the inside was empty. But right after we ordered, the place quickly filled up! Wow.   The service was superb. I couldn't have asked for a better server. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: I came here to meet a friend for drinks and a light lunch -- we both got appetizers since we were planning heavier dinners later that night -- and when it comes to the food and drinks, I was not disappointed.   I got the vegetable samosas, and the samosas were nearly perfect, with the potato and pea filling having just the right level of seasoning. They came with beautiful mango chutney whose chunks were visible and a lovely green chutney. Both were so delicious I was hard put to decide which I wanted to put on each of the three samosas.  For drinks I had two of the Wasatch Polygamy (a nitro porter), and it was fantastic. It had a hint of sweetness, but wasn't as overwhelming as a milk stout, but also the delicious flavor of a porter.  The patio dining was great, with plenty of shade.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that service was... slow, with respect to both drinks and food. Otherwise, the whole thing was outstanding.

reviews.author: Maribel D.
reviews.description: Visiting San Marcos and North street popped up on my Yelp top restaurants.  Restaurant is in a renovated older house with super cute outdoor patio seating. We sat inside it's smaller but very cozy. They have a bar with many draft beers, wine and specialty drinks.  We started with the vegetable samosas and it came with side of mint sauce and mango chutney that was so tasty. Both complimented the samosas in a wonderful way. The flavors were amazing.  I ordered the tiki masala taco that was filled with so much flavor and very filling.       A must try!! And hubby had the trio which he choose tiki masala, curry chicken and butter chicken along with coconut rice. All three were fantastic.  Service was good and food was fantastic and very reasonably priced.  I'm excited to come back and try something new on the menu and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND North Street!! #supportsmallbusiness

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: Ok. Here comes another Indian restaurant review. But wait! Its TexMex Indian!  Went to lunch with coworkers on the first day of fall, so we got a table outdoors, never stepped foot inside. Service was slow, but it seemed it was only one waiter, so no points taken away for that.  Server was detailed in explaining what everything was and the level of spice and comfort. We had one vegan and one spice sensitive guest in our group, so he pointed out what would be best for the group to order. I ordered chicken nachos, and paneer tacos, wanting spice and meat. Other guests ordered samosas with mango chutney, vegan nachos, and spinach paneer. It was filling enough with a beautiful presentation! The jalapeno cream mixed with tamarind on the tacos mixed perfectly with the Indian spices.  The curry on the shredded chicken and tortilla chips (couldn't tell if they were made in house or store bought) had me trying not to lock the bowl. Will definitely go back to try more items on the menu!

reviews.author: Josh Y.
reviews.description: Hilariously good Tex/Indian fusion. The chicken Tika and curry tacos are out of this world. The queso is ok. But seriously, if you're not already in San Marcos, come here. And eat this. It's that good. If you think you're a foodie and haven't tried this, fix that. So incredibly good. And for $9 per taco that's basically a meal and a party in your mouth, it doesn't exactly set you back much. They have a great beer selection too and cool ambiance and attentive service. But the tacos are the draw. Come here. Eat the Indian style tacos. 5 stars.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: This is my absolute favorite spot in San Marcos for dinner! I take all my friends here when I get the chance. It's a must any time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Akhilesh B.
reviews.description: Hidden Gem! I have never had so much authentic flavors of North Indian food in the whole of US until I tried this small Indian place close to Texas State University. The food is great, the staff very friendly and the ambiance makes you feel you are in India!

reviews.author: Lily L.
reviews.description: I ordered the butter chicken and tiki masala tacos and everything was amazing!!! Definitely will be back when I'm in town.

reviews.author: Dylan Z.
reviews.description: Food is good but the rice portion is super weak.  I even ordered an extra side of rice half way through our meal and it still wasn't enough.  Curry is only good with that harmonious balance of rice.  Kind of a deal breaker.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: I got a to go order here. The place was super cute with a nice ambiance. The food was amazing! I'll be back to dine in!

reviews.author: Jillian J.
reviews.description: Delicious food albeit a tab pricey for what it is. Super sweet service staff. Slow ass kitchen but the food is worth the wait. Chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Unique spot with a mix of great options of drafts and curries!  We enjoy having different types of beers and this place has a good unique assortment of drafts to try.  I was able to get some lavender cider since it was pretty early in the day, but the porter and stout options were very tempting (some at over 12% alcohol).  The dogs were with us so we settled outside in their spacious yard that has a lot of shade and a fan blowing.  We ordered curry fries as an appetizer and they were wedged exactly like chic fil a fries seasoned in a curry mix powder.  These were good, but can do with a pinch of sugar and lots of extra spice.  I had the chicken Tikka masala plate and my husband got the chicken 65 taco.  The taco looked more like a wrap and wasn't as filling as what he expected, but tasted pretty good.  Fried chicken seasoned in sauce inside the taco had a good kick to it.  My chicken Tikka masala plate was delicious, but a little extra spice would help.  Also, I think the restaurant can do better by adding naan! Great concept to check out!

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: The Katz brothers have done it again. Delicious food, y'all. The trio is worth ordering the first time you go, just to familiarize yourself with the place. And the tap menu is phenomenal (shocker ).

reviews.author: Arundathi R.
reviews.description: One of the best restaurants that serves Indian Fusion food. Everything was so delicious  All the flavours are perfect, very Indian. Would love to come back!!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Have gone twice. Service was good both times and the food is fantastic. I enjoyed and would recommend the curry trio; it allows you to try a little bit of multiple items to decide which is your favorite. Good vegetarian options as well.  Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Adrienne E.
reviews.description: A Gem. Concept is to sit outside under the big pecan tree, eat great Indian food, watch the dogs play in the "dog park"  seating area, drink lassis or craft beer, enjoy great service and listen to their fun music selection. So relaxing and satisfying.

reviews.author: Liam G.
reviews.description: Food is low A tier, high B tier, however they don't serve naan, and their rice to entree portions are embarrassing, would recommend this place ONLY if you have your own NAAN and have a coupon for a free side of rice

reviews.author: Jo O.
reviews.description: We couldn't believe that we've lived in the area for so long and had never found this restaurant. The variety on the menu and flavors were incredible. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: Loved this place! The ambiance is so cute, whether you sit inside or outside. It's not *as* good as authentic Indian food, but it's pretty good! I would highly recommend getting the curry queso, it was delicious!

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: In the latest wave of gentrification in this town, it seems like all I can find are hipster breweries that serve "craft" beer and overpriced food served on rectangular plates. If you like that kind of crap, go to aqua brew, you animal. If you want to go somewhere with cheap drinks and cool people (and if you live north of campus like this guy), look no further than Treff's. Some highlights.  You call it nights and you call it week:  Every Sunday, Treff's does $2.50 you call its, and $2.00 you call its on Tuesday. In addition to that, Treff's picks one week out of every month to be You call it week. That means $2 you call its all week. Going there, getting piss drunk, and stumbling back to my apartment, is among my fondest memories.   Atmosphere:  This place is dirty and divey in the best of ways. I used to go here with my friend from work all the time, and I always enjoyed seeing the bartenders and regulars. Really interesting people. Another upside is the patio, which allows filthy smokers like myself to smoke, drink, and have interesting conversations with other people. Another thing to mention, though, is that Treff's is much more of working people's bar. If you're a frat bro or sorority girl looking to blow mommy and daddy's money on a night of partying, you probably won't have a lot in common with the people here.  The glasses: This is just a little nitpick of mine, but I always hate going to the square and getting served drinks in a plastic cup. Treff's gets ridiculously busy some nights, and they still manage to serve all of their booze in glass, which is something I like. On another note, the bartenders here are absolute rock stars, and they don't take shit from anyone.   I haven't gone in a while since I don't have anyone to go with, but you can bet your ass the first place I'm taking my girlfriend when she turns 21 is gonna be Treff's.

reviews.author: Todd B.
reviews.description: I wandered around the square and didn't find anything besides frat boys doing brunch. Found my way to this place and it was great. Not for everyone but if you want a local crew and a few cold drinks and shots this is your place. I loved it and it will be even better when the upstairs is open. Not for children. Adults only in a drinking sense.

reviews.author: Kick I.
reviews.description: Patrick T. is full of BS- he did not open The Tavern when he was 25.  It was in existence way before he blew into San Marcos, and was known as the coolest, anti-frat bar in San Marcos.  That's why he bought it from Andy and Ben Linn, original owners.  He has expanded, added alot of TV s and updated the interior, but it will never be the place it was in the late 80's.  Keep blowing smoke, Patrick, - the Green Parrot is calling your name.

reviews.author: Enrique T.
reviews.description: They obviously water down their liquor. Had 7+ shots and only felt buzzed. We are not heavy drinkers in general.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Treffs is a nice casual spot to hangout, drink, play games and have a good time. It's a nice gem away from the square. They have $2 you call it week once a month! Can't beat it. Karaoke is also offered on Sundays, which is my favorite day to visit. Different events are hosted just about every day of the week. Although they don't serve food, they allow you to order at the restaurants near by and enjoy it there while washing it down with a cold alcoholic drink. Pretty awesome!

reviews.author: Estefania Z.
reviews.description: I loved Treff's until they kicked out my brother.ñ for some lame excuse. One of the bartenders is racist af and he should be kicked out.

reviews.author: Re'Ven S.
reviews.description: I love the $2 you call it weekalthough not all drinks are $2 and they fail to inform you of this before ordering it. I was willing to look pass this until I went in around 12am and had a few drink and was allowed to order a drink at 1:52am and they close at 2am. At 2:03 they bouncer was stand at our table demanding that two of my girlfriends and I chug our drinks and leave when we stated we'd like to not get drunk and drive the entire bar staff proceed to attack us and demand we finish our drinks, that we had just got and paid for, and leave or they'd take them. I felt very uncomfortable and attack so my friends and I just left. It was not a good way to end my night.

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: The bouncers and bartenders are always so friendly and have always enjoyed going to get a drink and chill. 10/10

reviews.author: Travis M.
reviews.description: It's Treffs.  Great owner and bartenders. It's got a ton of $2 you call it weeks and every Tuesday.

reviews.author: Lee W.
reviews.description: 3 stars because the ratio of ADULTS to college kids was surprisingly good. i.e. greater than 3:1. Im 48 and looking to not be around college kids every time I go grab a beer. Im kinda done with that nonsense, ya get me? I'll know more next time. Cool place.

reviews.author: Alyssa C.
reviews.description: My friends and I were here this past Friday with other work friends and we ordered a round of drinks. A few minutes later another friend met up with us and brought a round of shots. Within 10 minutes of being there a bouncer came up to us and told us we need to leave because we were "too drunk". I told him we weren't and we hadn't drank at all before we got there, we had all just been at a work function. He told us the bartender saw us walking to the bathroom "looking drunk". He wouldn't let us finish our drinks that we had just been served and only made the 4 people with shots out of my friend group leave. I think the staff there is racist just like other reviews are saying. Won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Anon A.
reviews.description: Well liquors were $2 tonight, and we were served well vodka and charged $6 a shot! The bartender who is also manager and share-holder DID NOT MENTION TO US  that well vodka in the form of a pickle shot would be $6. As a longtime bartender being served by a long term bartender, when I'm told "wells are $2" I trusted that Chad would be honest with us. Instead, he took us to the cleaners. If I could give no stars I would. I have been in San Marcos for over 10 years. About 6 years ago I was man-handled by a door guy for no reason. I did not return to Treff's for almost 4 years. Since then, I have gone back a handful of times in hopes that it was just "one bad apple", but now I see that the employees at Treff's are out for nothing more than money. Even the door guy tonight was short and smile-less. I have received nothing less than awful service at this bar and I will not be returning.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: I would definitely love to give Treff's more stars but to myself it is a solid 3.5.   This was my second visit to Treff's because the first time i had been there i did not have a great experience. However, I am a big fan a second chances because who knows what might had been going on that night.   The drink prices are very reasonable. Whiskey Sours only $3.50 and then they have some killer drink specials during the week I believe on Sundays and Tuesdays they have -You - Call -  Its- for only $2!!   The upstairs bar area has a bunch of darts to play and even a pac-man arcade game to entertain with.   As for this little dive, I would return.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As a graduate of Texas State, I lived up the street from Treff's and spent moderate amount of time and money here. Great little place. A toss between "dive" and "college bar", this establishment has cheap drink specials and the students know it! Beer selection is moderate, but for a college hangout there's a few local and craftbeers in the mix of domestic "moneymaker" beers.  The bar gets super busy, especially during "$2 Tuesdays" when everything is $2 and I mean EVERYTHING! With other various specials during the week, this is a must if you're a student looking to have a good time and stretch you're student loan/ scholarship/ college fund/ or emergency credit card that mom gave you just a little more...

reviews.author: Karson E.
reviews.description: Cheryl is great. Prices are good. Happy hour deals are fantastic, and games are available to play upon request.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Monday: $5 Pitcher Beer Night  Tuesday: $2 You Call It  Cool joint, cheap drinks and usually always pretty full inside. Oh yeah, and Happy Hour starts Early @ 2pm.  Parking is a little limited but there is more behind Grins.   Good place if you just wanna get away from the Square or try something different.

reviews.author: Mindy N.
reviews.description: Awesome bar with a great, casual, cozy environment. It's perfect for nights where you just want to be in the comfort of good company and drinks. The people are what really makes this place! Brandon, our bartender that night, was a blast to get to know and talk to. Excited to come back!

reviews.author: Alicia D.
reviews.description: Love this bar! It is fun and down to earth. Great drink specials! Best nights are 2 dollar u call it Tuesdays and Sundays! Sundays also has karaoke and they play all the football games!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: So I went here on a Saturday.  The inside was wayyyy too loud, and very little people were inside. Their selection of beers was so/so, although I had heard that they had more than what they actually had.  The parking lot was awful. Construction going on and one way in and out. Only about 10-13 cars could park and you can forget it if you're driving a truck, as the guy driving a f250 found out after hitting the parked Mercedes.  Not a great place for a huge group of people, but not bad for a San Marcos bar. When visiting just be wary of the parking lot and crazy drivers.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: So I'm usually at Treff's on Tuesdays for $2 you-call-its (best deal on the best night to go) but tonight was a friend's birthday and she wanted to have a few drinks there before heading to Austin.   Well, as usual, we squished into a parking spot in the front of the tavern, walked in and sat at an open bar stool. I ordered an Ace pear cider and started chatting with friends while the jukebox was going with a vast array of music choices! Thats the beauty of a jukebox and I love the diversity!  Okay so I decided to check in (via Yelp) and saw that they had an offer for $2 drinks which really excited me because it wasn't a Tuesday and I still could get some $2 drinks? HELL YEAH!  WELLLLLLL.... it was more like a HELLLLLL NO because the bartender didn't allow me to redeem my deal. He even said he texted the owner and that the owner had no idea what kind of deal I was talking about? Well, the offer is still open on my Yelp app and I plan to find the owner next time I'm at the bar and ask him about it because that offer didn't magically come to be!!!  Anyway, yes Treff's is a super chill, casual and cool bar but they lost some points with not accepting my Yelp offer (I mean that's what the offers are there for hellloooooo)!! Guess I'll stick to only going in on Tuesdays...

name: Patio Dolcetto
accommodations: Street Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! Food and service was great. Everything was reasonably priced. Flight of cider was so good. Loved the blackberry one from a place in Sequin. Pizza was delicious but the recipe that I loved the most was the baked Brie! Can't wait to come back her and enjoy the very chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely amazing!!! It's so charming and romantic. The food is delicious. The drinks are great then the music is fantastic for the atmosphere. The staff are so sweet. I'd definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Shelby and Grace were great helps all night! Cider flight- problem the best idea i had other than ordering the pizza ! The blackberry mead was probably my fave cider! Also the cider flight is $10!  The pizzas are pretty good! I got the white blanc both times and added pepperoni and jalapeños to one and just jalapeños to the other!  Again, i place to stop by after floating the river( normal times) or shopping at the outlets!

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING. We saw it while driving around looking for somewhere to go and it caught our eye so we checked it out. We were a bit more casually dressed as I would've liked, but it's okay because it was our first visit.   The vibes here are amazing. Everything looks nice and sophisticated. We both had drinks, a couple of martinis and something else that I can't quite remember.   The Brie was something new to my boyfriend, and we really enjoyed it. My Margherita pizza was perfect and my boyfriend Chicken Blanc pizza was also sooo good. I think his was better than mine, lol!   I recommend this place to everyone I run into. It's so cute and the perfect date night

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Obsessed with this place! I've been many times before but we went for my friends 22nd birthday today and loved it. The pizzas are AMAZING and our waitress, Kennedy, was so nice and patient. Everything on the menu is 10/10 !!!

reviews.author: Lilly V.
reviews.description: we loved Shelia!!! she was amazing. she took care of us and made us feel so comfortable   love pat dolc and love Shelia!!!!!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: We arrived around 10:30pm on Saturday, and we could sit wherever we want, minimal people there. Our order was taken quickly and the drinks/food were super fast as well. I highly recommend for a place to get drinks and talk with friends, but be mindful that the food is finger-food and limited!

reviews.author: Koral R.
reviews.description: Baked Brie and white sangria was a must. Order a flight of beer for the friend. We all enjoyed the ambiance and the fact that there was heaters outdoors for us.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Tonight we tried out this quaint wine bar for the first time. For a tapas bar, they offer a limited menu. This is the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars Bec we expected more selection. They have a few cheese plate options and small gourmet pizzas. I chose the pear and bacon pizza, which was delicious. my husband had a pepperoni pizza. I also ordered a sangria flight, which was quite nice. On Thursday nights they offer a free lava cake with the purchase of a flight. The lava cake was tasty. The servers were friendly and the decorations were nice.

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Pizza is amazing, definitely individual sized. Try the pear and bacon! Drinks were good priced and were amazing. Had a great night here! 100 would recommend. Loved our server! The lights were too cute on the patio!

reviews.author: Martha H.
reviews.description: Went here with a friend and it was totally lovely-- we sat outside, the vibe was perfect and the wine was good. Our server was great, she was friendly, had good recommendations and was super quick... we will definitely come back

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Nice environment and atmosphere :)   Better service the second time around.

reviews.author: Laney E.
reviews.description: Service was excellent and the pear and bacon pizza is a must try!! Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Brittany F.
reviews.description: Trendy spot in San Marcos for wine and cheese. Can get crowded if it's too hot for anyone to want to sit outside. There is overflow parking across the street, appropriately signed as extra parking for Patio Dolcetto.  Someone put a lot of effort and love into designing the space.   Alex the bartender was very friendly and our group had good conversation with him.   They have a Sunday Special right now: a bottle of wine (5 options) and a cheese board for $25. The cheese board had water crackers, Marcona almonds, dried apricots, craisins (?), jam, Olive tapenade, a smoked Gouda, a cheddar - almost like TJs unexpected cheddar, but more firm and reminiscent of Parmesan (not crumbly like UC), and a chèvre (I think). All very tasty.   We did the special twice. The White Zin was given to us on accident (instead of the merlot we requested) but they're very low key and friendly and we try to be easy going (especially about wine!) so we enjoyed the Zin.   I look forward to checking out other specials and enjoying the nice atmosphere outside when it gets a little cooler.

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: I stopped here with a friend on our drive from Austin to San Antonio and will definitely be making the trip back to San Marcos to visit again! I ordered the white sangria, which fair warning was very sweet but it was still delicious. The menu said the white sangria had ginger in it, although I didn't taste that specific ingredient I was hoping for, it was still a good choice. They do wine flights as well, and have a pretty good happy hour.  We ordered a cheese board and sat at the bar. The cheese board was generous and filling, the service was great, and the atmosphere was on point. It is a casual wine bar, and they had live music outside which would have been nice to watch aside from the cold weather. They have a lot of seating outside, and a good amount of community seating inside.  Overall, great experience here and will be hopefully going back!

reviews.author: Anna V.
reviews.description: Absolutely Amazing!!!! The pictures say it all, I would definitely recommend to all of my friends.

reviews.author: Mitch G.
reviews.description: A great place. Small indoor outdoor wine bar with small snacks and pizzas. Really well priced drinks and great tasting food! Would recommend the Pear and Bacon Pizza but maybe pass on the charcuterie board (it's a bit $$ and not very big) but overall great staff, service, snacks and drinks!

reviews.author: Kathleen B.
reviews.description: Love everything about the place. Excellent staff and very helpful when choosing a wine. One of the nicest bars in San Marcos. Love to take out of town guests here.

reviews.author: Caitlyn W.
reviews.description: Love this place! The girls that work there are super chill and background music is great.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: This place is delicious with a fantastic scenery. The only thing that I wish this place had was more food options to go with amazing wine and cocktails. I highly recommend going out for a girls night here or perhaps even a date night! Their wine flights are a must try!

name: 54th Street Restaurant and Drafthouse
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: We've been coming here since it opened and it never disappoints!!  It's our go to place with kids or without!  Cold *ass beer, amazing sangria margaritas!!  Food wise -  Heathy option - the protein bowls are great!   Comfort - the chicken Madeira, Prime rib sandwich, Buffalo chicken salad.  Extremely affordable - kids love it!  Great staff!

reviews.author: Mimi D.
reviews.description: I can't review the food but the front staff service is rude and hostile.   We put our name on the wait list and when we arrived we were told we were mistaken.   She even said we must not have clicked the confirm button.  Then she rudely said it'll be a 45 min wait!  Well if we didn't successfully complete the process, how did we get this text??   You don't treat your customers like an inconvenience and that's exactly how they treated us.

reviews.author: Monty W.
reviews.description: Leaving the Outlet Malls and headed back home via Hwy 21, we needed a lunch spot on the "right" side of the interstate for easy in/out. 54th Street hit all of those needs.  We were promptly seated by a super sweet hostess. We have a toddler and we were able to grab the booth highchair on the way to our table instead of getting to the table and then waiting for a highchair. I know that doesn't mean a lot, but 90% of the restaurants we visit, we have to wait for them to seat us then they bring a highchair to our table. By them having the booth highchairs at the hostess station, they are "working smarter, not harder". Big kudos the them for that.  Our waiter was (forgive me for I didn't catch his name) was extremely knowledgeable of the menu and helpful for all questions.   I had the Cherry Limeade to go along with the Gringo Dip and Chips we ordered for our appetizer. Both the limeade and the chips/dip were outstanding. I would recommend both.  For entrees, we had the Prime Rib French Dip and the Havana Club. The French dip is the first sandwich listed and I didn't read any further. I'm a sucker for a good French Dip and this sandwich delivered. The wife commented that her Havana Club was delicious as well. The kids had grilled cheeses with fries. All looked great and they devoured them.  All in all, this is the spot you're wanting for an easy off/on when traveling north on I-35. We'll be back when we are in the area.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: We tried out 54th late on a Sunday night. It is nice that they have extended hours while most others still have reduced hours. I checked in online before we showed up, and we were seated immediately. We both had the vodka strawberry lemonade cocktail, which was very sweet and weak. I ordered a chicken avocado sandwich with sweet potato fries.  My husband ordered the chicken quesadilla. Our food was prepared quickly. My sandwich was tasty, as well as the fries. My husband said the quesadillas were spicy.

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: Let me start off and let you know my husband is very hard on his critique of restaurants. This was our first time here. Thanks to a friends recommendation we tried it today. Seriously the best steaks that we have had in a restaurant. They were literally cooked perfectly. It was the right amount of portions. I also got the basil lemonade. Our waitress was super sweet and efficient. Both my husband and I give this place a two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Dee M.
reviews.description: I came here with a friend yesterday and our server was great!  I want to say his name is Tee, but I might be wrong.  He found a way to cheer us up after he saw me distressed over something.  I really appreciate his kind gesture.  The sandwich with the au jus was delicious.  Fried pickles were tasty and crispy.  The chocolate cake and ice cream were very tasty.  The service was impeccable!

reviews.author: Carolina S.
reviews.description: Food is great and Maria's service was amazing. We enjoyed our visit, we'll definitely be visiting again.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: If I could give ZERO stars I would. My fiance and I are regulars here, have always loved the food and drink selection. After tonight we will no longer be returning to 54th street restaurant. We had family come in from 2 hours away to try the food we always talk about, and were turned away, REFUSE us service because our party of 13 was "too large". Yet there was a party of 12 that didn't show for their reservation and still we were refused service. It was supposed to be the graduation dinner for my fiance and this is how it turned out. It is not our fault that the restaurant is understaffed, but losing us as loyal customers definitely is their fault. Save your time and $ take your family somewhere else.

reviews.author: Kristy S.
reviews.description: An hour and half wait for 3 adults 3 kids so I'm expecting great food and service.  Overall it was good.  Food I ordered blackened ribeye and pina colada.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  My daughter ordered the butter penne pasta with side of sweet strawberries, ice cream and strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was fresh and not overly sweet.  My husband had ribs. My friend had ribeye with blackened shrimp. Everything was tasty.  Waiter tried but kept forgetting stuff. We didn't get straws till 20 min after our drinks were served. Like no one got straws to drink.   then he kept forgetting the refills and my glass of water.  My 5 yo noticed and commented on the server's forgetfulness. He was nice but he's obviously new-- he didn't know the menu well at all. But it's fine, we had a good dinner. Price was very decent.

reviews.author: Melissa W.
reviews.description: My sister and I came here for lunch today. Restaurant was clean and service was very fast. I ordered the loaded fries with gringo sauce and my sister ordered chicken wraps with ranch. Food was awesome! Our waitress was on top of things as well. I would definitely plan on coming back this was my first time here. We also had sweet teas and they were good as well.

reviews.author: Blake L.
reviews.description: Camryn was our waitress here...she was very PERSONABLE, KIND, and HELPFUL during our time here. The food was great and the portions were very generous.   Thank you Camryn for your incredible service while we were here!

reviews.author: Skyler B.
reviews.description: I wouldn't recommend this place at all. The salad tasted soapy and all of my tables food was cold. When we brought it up to the waitress she was nonchalantly rude. We tried to come to a conclusion but she thought it was best to walk away while I was in the middle of speaking with her. Service was laughable and food was mediocre on a good day. Save your money and time.

reviews.author: Melanie G.
reviews.description: My first time trying this place, as it was one of the only places open late tonight, and it was really good! I had the Havana Club sandwich with the Chicken Tortilla Soup on the side and the Key Lime Pie for dessert. The sandwich was great! Pretty big and definitely worth the price. The soup was also good as well. The pie was great and unlike any other pie I've had, tangy and with amazing crust.  Overall the atmosphere of the restaurant was great, especially for the night time. Its got a cluttered pop-culture type decor style, similar to that of Beyond Burger, nice dim lighting, and huge comfortable booths. Our waitress was also very kind and did a great job. I highly recommend this place, especially in the night time for the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Rick S.
reviews.description: One of the coolest places to take someone to with great food! Look at the awe in my nephews face

reviews.author: Joel D.
reviews.description: Had been here pre Covid and thought it was great. Came back yesterday and was charged $12.99 for an Old Fashion drink at the bar. I do not mind paying for alcohol, but this is ridiculous and seems like gouging. The drink was good, but $12.99?????? That's almost double what they are anywhere else. Will not be back, make it up on someone else.

reviews.author: Erieser C.
reviews.description: The waiting time was less than expected, the waiter was very attentive.  To start we ordered a Four Play, I regret not having a photo, but I can tell you it was delicious, the sauces that accompany this order were excellent, all excellent, the fried potatoes, the mozzarella, the spicy chicken but with a good flavor.  In addition this time we ordered the same Plate, Flat-iron steak and shrimp with mashed potatoes, I found the steak cooking to be perfect, as well as the shrimp just right.  We recommend a delicious beergarita.  Only you have to prepare your wallet, it is not cheap, but you will enjoy it.

reviews.author: Tony N.
reviews.description: Seen this restaurant and wanted to try the happy hour. Made it a few mins before it was over so got some appetizers in. Of course we over order since everything sounded good. Lol but what I liked the most was the tequila wrapper. They are so good with their dipping sauce. Staff was friendly here as well.

reviews.author: Christopher J.
reviews.description: Ordered delivery to my hotel nearby.  Requested utensils.  Didn't get them. Salad looked good.  Wish I could have eaten it..

reviews.author: Kristen N.
reviews.description: Went in for lunch and forgot how yummy their food is! We had a couple of chicken protein bowls. One was blackened and the other grilled and I added Buffalo sauce. The chicken was cooked perfectly! And the veggies has a nice grill and char! Fantastic, fast, hot and plentiful! And the staff is very nice! Hubby had a Reuben that was huge and great seasoned fries!!!sorry no pics but trust me it was good!

reviews.author: Casey R.
reviews.description: This place was a jewel of a find! Just 4 miles up from the San Marcos premium outlets this place is well worth the stop. A gentleman from North face recommended it to us and we are thankful we listened. The best way I can describe this place is a pub like feel with amazing pub like food and even better personal service! The gluten free menu was AMAZING and I felt safe eating here as a celiac! The rest of our group had plenty of option as well. Two of us had burgers and the other had soup and sandwich and we enjoyed every bite! Jeanne was our server (hope I spelt that correctly) and she did a great job helping us choose menu items! If we ever come back to Austin/San Marcos this will be a stop on our list!! The gluten free burger was so good, the bun was not crumbly or taste like cardboard but perfect! I actually took home half of the bun to eat later... ha! Thanks 54th Street, it was great!

name: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub + Texas Grub
